loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rose Andala

texts.en:
Rose A. is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband John works as a technician. Two of her children are in high school and the other two are in primary school. 

Rose was introduced to KADET by her friends who had joined a group. She has never borrowed from any sources other from KADET. She repaid her first loan very well and on time. She has applied for a second loan which she plans to invest in her business; using it for restocking and using part of the money to pay school fees for her children.

Rose sells decorated tablecloths and women clothes. Her business is in a semi-urban area with few business, so competition is low. Her customers are from the surrounding community, but she also sells to retailers from other places. 

Rose intends to buy an embroidery sewing machine so she can cater to her customers' tastes and demands. She also hopes to buy fabric in bulk to increase her returns.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en una casa alquilada y tiene muchas ganas de progresar en la vida, sabe que con mucho trabajo lo puede lograr. En San Antonio de Putina (Provincia del departamento de Puno), se encuentra el centro poblado La Mina Rinconada (predominantemente minero), a mas de 5400 m.s.n.m. Isidora ha logrado poner una tienda, en la cual vende de todo, por lo que es muy concurrida por los moradores de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus productos y ayudar al progreso de este poblado, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frió, pero aun así sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte para sobresalir. Para un futuro cercano, Isidora espera que su negocio crezca mucho más y se convierta en uno de las tiendas principales del poblado. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y tiene pensado acceder a otros más, por lo cual quiere pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, ya que es muy responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
At the age of 36, Isidora is a hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in a rented house and has the will to make progress in life. Isidora knows that she has to work hard in order to succeed.

In San Antonio de Putina (a province in the district of Puno) lies the central town of La Mina Rinconada, which is predominantly a mining area. Among the more than 5400 inhabitants of this area, she has managed to open a store that sells everything. Her business is very popular with the residents. What she likes most about her job is selling her products and helping bring progress to this town. Isidora has been in business for 14 years and believes the hardest part of her job is enduring the cold weather, but she knows she has to put up with it in order to succeed. In the near future, Isidora expects her business to grow even more so that it becomes one of the main shops in town.

Isidora is taking her fourth loan with MFP. She plans to access more loans in the future, which is all the reason to make her payments on time and not cause problems for her Communal Bank. She holds her fellow group members in high regard because they are very responsible. With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy more products to improve the inventory of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells foodstuffs such as melons, pepper, etc. She is 51 year old and married with one child. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve quality of her business place

loans.name: Dilnura

texts.en:
Dilnura is married with a little child. She runs a small store selling groceries. She has been in this business for 9 years. Dilnura is very cheery and optimistic. Her little grocery store faces high competition as there are many supermarkets in the neighborhood. However, her customer-friendly service and the individual attention she can give help her keep loyal customers.

Her responsibility and perseverance have helped Dilnura repay all loans she has received from “IMON International”. Dilnura is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni for a couple of purposes. She is going to do some remodeling work inside her vending facility and she’d like to increase the assortment of food products she has available. This loan will help Dilnura expand her business, having a positive impact on her profitability and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods  to increase the range of items sold

loans.name: Silvia Ester

texts.es: Silvia Ester L. C. reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque del departamento de Cuscatlán. Silvia tiene 53 años de edad vive con su hija y sus dos nietas de 11 y 8 años de edad. Silvia crio sola a su hija quien es ahora toda una mujer, que  ha dado sus dos únicos nietos, para Silvia el tener su propio negocio la hacen sentir independiente y activa, ella posee un puesto en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque donde vende cereales y  otros productos como huevos, cuadernos entre otros. El destino del crédito que solicita Silvia es para invertir en productos para su local como detergentes, comida para aves, huevos y cereales.
texts.en:
Silvia Ester L. C. lives in the municipality of Cojutepeque in the deparment of Cuscatlán. Silvia is 53 years old and lives with her daughter and her two granddaughters (11 and 8). Silvia raised her daughter to womanhood as a single mom. Having her own business makes Silvia feel independent and active. She has a stall in the municipal market of Cojutepeque where she sells basic grains and other products like eggs, notebooks, and other things. Silvia will use her loan to purchase products for business like detergent, bird food, eggs, and grains. .

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Elías de 35 años y Fabricio de 5 añitos de edad, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a elaboración de prendas de vestir, actividad que desarrolla muy creativamente desde hace un año y medio. Con este negocio obtiene buenos ingresos para la manutención de su familia, ya que elabora cada una de sus prendas con mucho ahínco y dedicación, poniendo en práctica toda su creatividad, resultándole bonitos y variados modelos. Además de ello, también compra prendas ya listas, las cuales vende por su vecindario a pedido, resultándole muy rentable.
Para el futuro, Eugenia quiere tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas en grandes vitrinas y en un local que tenga gran afluencia de público.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, desde que se inició con su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa de verano, ya que se acerca esta temporada. También adquirirá material para elaborar sus propias prendas.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 52, lives with her husband and two sons: Elías, 35 and Fabricio, 5, in their own home. She makes clothes, a creative activity she has undertaken for the last year and a half. With this business she makes good earnings to help support her family since she makes each item with much devotion and dedication putting all of her creativity into play; this yields beautiful and varied models. Besides, she also buys ready-made clothing items which she sells to order in her neighborhood. This, too, is very profitable. For the future, Eugenia would like to have a big store in a commercial spot that has a lot of foot traffic where she can offer her clothing items in large display cases . This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been very timely in her repayments ever since she began with the group. With the funds acquired she will buy a larger quantity of Summer clothes since that season is nearing. She will also buy fabric to make her own items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 39 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de edades 16 y 14.  Es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos como recorredora hace más de 10 años. Ella compra sus productos en la ciudad de Trujillo y luego los entrega a sus clientes en sus domicilios.  Su vivienda está ubicado en el distrito de la Tinguiña en la avenida principal. En su casa tiene una pequeña vitrina el cual exide sus productos. Ella comenzó con escasos recursos y ha logrado en crecer su negocio. Solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo ahora por la campaña navideña. Su sueño para el futuro es seguir creciendo su negocio el cual es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 39 years old and has two children who are 16 and 14 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her parents' home. She has worked selling shoes for more than 10 years. She buys her products in the city of Trujillo and later brings them to her clients' homes. Her home is located in the Tinguiña district on the main avenue. In her home she has a small display window where she displays her products. She started out with limited resources and has been able to grow in her business. She is asking for a loan for purchasing products for the Christmas season. Her dream in the future is to keep growing her business, as it is her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in shoes/merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace R. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen Grace owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helen Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Femi

texts.en: Femi is 35 years old and married with a child. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells machine parts to make a living. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa.  He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more machine parts to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more machine parts to sell

loans.name: Alfonso Ines

texts.es: El señor Alfonso Ines G. L., tiene 60 años de edad vive en el barrio Villa Revolucion es casado y la señora es directora de un colegio cerca de su casa, con su iongreso aporta a la económia del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad y que viven de manera independiente, dentro de los planes del señor G. estan las remodelaciones de su vivenda para lograr tener las mejores comodidades que la familia necesita, él tiene un pequeño taller mecanico en su casa, el es Pastor Evangelico y dirige una Iglesia, pero con estos embates de la naturaleza las condiciones de la infraestructura no son las más optimas por tal razon el señor Alfonso solicita este credito para levantar un muro en la parte lateral sur de la Iglesia, la ayuda que se le brindaría al señor vendría a apoyar una labor social, que a largo plazo podría significar mayor captacion de personas interesadas en la palabra de nuestro Señor Jesucristo y menos delicuentes y personas sin juicio ni beneficio.
texts.en:
Alfonso Ines G. L. is 60 years old and lives in the Villa Revolucion neighborhood. He is married, and his wife is the principal of a school near their house. She uses her income to support the family. They have two adult children who live on their own. Mr. G.'s plans include remodeling his house to make it more comfortable for his family. He has a small mechanic shop in his house. He is also an Evangelical pastor and runs a church, but because of the ravages of nature, the condition of the interior is not the best. For this reason, Alfonso asks for a loan to build a wall on the south side of the church. The help you offer this gentleman will go to support a social work that in the long term could mean a larger number of people who are interested in the word of our Lord Jesus Christ, and fewer deliquents and immoral people.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Frida es conviviente, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos, Frida se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y cochinilla, también cosecha de sus tierras, productos que vende a intermediarios en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Frida vende leña.
Frida necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la  compra de tara y cochinilla.
Los sueños de Frida son superarse mas y ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) Community Bank. She is married, 60 years old, and has eight children. Her job is buying and selling tara pods and cochineal; she also grows crops on her land and sells the produce to middlemen in the town of Ayacucho. She sells firewood as well. Frida needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy tara and cochineal. Her dream is to make a better life for herself and also to save enough to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tara pods and cochineal

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn S., age 40, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has four children. He is a skillful blacksmith. He operates his business at home, earning approximately US $6 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover the family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. He has been doing this business since 2005. His wife is a housewife who stays at home to look after the children and the household chores. Their standard of living has improved since S. started this business, so he wants to have a loan to expand his business. S. is requesting a loan of US $800 to purchase more metal. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. (S.'s wife is pictured in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy more metal

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María C. de 61 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de un edificio con el tiene 3 hijas. 

Debido a la falta de ingresos y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio María con la idea de su hija de vender ropa, inicio como vendedora informal en la esquina de su casa con camisas deportivas.

Ahora ella tiene su propio local aunque pequeño pero lo tiene surtido con camisas, pantalones, zapatos y en ocasiones con ropa interior. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa deportiva, zapatos para que su negocio este más surtido. En el futuro quiere ampliar el local del negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old María C. lives in an urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil in a house that is made of cement. Her husband works as a security guard in a building, and they have 3 daughters.

Due to her lack of funds and to the exasperating idea of having her own business, María decided to sell clothing. She started out selling athletic shirts informally in a corner of her home.

She now has her own small but well-stocked shop, where she sells shirts, pants, shoes, and sometimes even undergarments. She works from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day.

With this loan, she wants to buy sports apparel and footwear so that her business can be better stocked. In the future, she would like to expand her business space and reinforce her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sports apparel and footwear

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
CAMINANDO JUNTOS
Sabina es L. representante del grupo Caminando Juntos, las socias L. escogieron porque es una persona que inspira confianza ademas es puntual y responsable. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. comida en su casa pero eso no es sufieciente para elL. asi que aperturo una bodega en donD. atienD. con sus 6 hijos. ElL. es una pieza fundamental en su familia asi como tambien en el grupo.
Evelyn es L. tesorera D. grupo, se dedica a L. elaboracion, creación y venta D. dibujos para tareas en los colegios  D. L. zona D. Huaycan con diferentes tipos D. materiales, asi; como corospum cartulina y otros. ElL. tiene mucha demanda en las meses D. abril y mayo que es L. epoca del comienzo del año escolar. L. social invertira el prestamo para incrementar su stock D. materiales.
Con mucho esfuerzo Sara pudo adquirir maquinas D. costura y remalle para su propio taller D. confecciones donD. trabaja realizando servicios para terceros y asi poder mantener a su familia. Sus 3 hijos son su motor para salir adelante. Su actual pareja L. apoya  con  los gastos en casa ya que es viuda D. su primer compromise.  El objetivo D. Sara es poder brindar trabajo a sus compañeras en su taller. 
L. Alcancia Comunal D. L. zona alta D. Huaycan esta conforme con los creditos y desean continuar trabajando con KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
Sabina is the representative of the group Caminando Juntos ("Walking Together"). The group members chose her as representative because she is someone who inspires confidence in addition to being punctual and responsible. Sabina works selling food from her home but it does not proviD. sufficient income, so she opened a bodega where she works with her six children. She is a fundamental part of her family as she is in the group. Evelyn is the group's treasurer. She develops, creates, and sells the drawings used in homework at local schools in the Huaycan zone. They are done in different types of material, such as plastic foam and cardboard among others. There is high demand for her work in April and May, since it is the beginning of the school year. Evelyn will invest her loan in buying more materials for her work. Through a lot of effort, Sara was able to get sewing and mending machines for her dressmaking shop. By doing services for third parties, she is able to support her family. Her three children are her motivation for getting ahead. Her current partner helps her with household costs as she is a widow from her first engagement. Sara's goal is to be able to proviD. work for her companions in her shop. The Huaycan area's community piggy bank is happy with its loans and hopes to continue working with Kiva and Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for businesses

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en: Mrs. Phallin Y. and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Noun, live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have three sons and one daughter — three in school and the youngest still at home. Phallin has run a grocery store in front of her house for more than ten years with the help of her husband. She also rents a space in her house to garment factory workers. She hopes to continue expanding the number of rooms she rents to the workers in order to generate income. She is requesting her second loan of 400USD, to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth H. O. tiene 42 años y vive en la localidad Suba en el noroccidente del Distrito Capital de Bogotá, en un área residencial y comercial cerca de una de las terminales   transportes de la ciudad. La Sra. Yaneth trabajó hace 2 años y medio en una empresa hasta que perdió su empleo y fue entonces cuando se dedicó a la confección de ropa en la línea deportiva, actividad que ahora realiza con una sobrina y ahora espera a una familiar de Bucaramanga para empezar a crecer. En este momento confecciona de manera satelital pero sueña con independizarse y tener su propia línea de ropa deportiva en el futuro. Ahora solicita un crédito, su primero con la F.M.S.D., con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una máquina cortadora, una mesa de corte y una máquina collarín que la ayudarán su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth H. O. is 42 years old and lives in the Suba neighborhood in the northwest of the capital district of Bogotá, in a residential and commercial area close to the city transportation terminals. Yaneth worked for a company for two and half years unti she lost her job, and it was then that she started making clothes for a sports line. She currently does this with her neice and is waiting for a relative from Bucaramanga to join and grow their operations. At the moment she works for another company, but she dreams of working for herself and having her own line of sports clothing in the future. She is requesting her first loan from FMSD with the goal of investing it in buying a cutting machine, a cutting table, and a sewing machine which will be of help to her in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cutting machine, a cutting table, and a sewing machine which will be of help to her in the business.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 50 years old and married with 8 children aged 11 to 28 years old. Five of the children are currently in school. She is a farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale town. She has been farming for 10 years with only one employee. Her main produce is milk which she sells to the milk vendors who in turn supply to the industries. She also earns income from vegetables that she sells to the local market. 

She recently completed her third loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.25,000. She has requested this loan from Juhudi for KES.30,000 to expand her poultry project. She says the income from this loan will assist her in educating her children and providing for her family. Her biggest challenge in mixed farming business is the high chances of dairy animals falling sick, hence expensive to treat. In future, she intends to add more acreage of her land to enable her to expand her farming activities.

She appreciates the fact that Juhudi has supported her from the first loan up to this fourth loan.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun S. is 56 years old and a villager in Ream Andaeuk village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bros S. (pictured with her), are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice and cane. The couple has three children – one is a construction worker, one stays at home and supports the farming business, while the youngest is a student in the local school.
To support their farm, Mrs. Moeun S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a laborer to plow the farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a laborer to plow the farm

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She takes care of additional family members (her old parents). Zam owns a charcoal store in the Kalerwe market and sells to all categories of people.  

She plans to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal to increase her stock. She has been selling charcoal for the last 10 years. Zam buys bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero and sells both on a retail and wholesale basis. Besides this charcoal business, she also gets additional income from a motorcycle. 

Her customers are the local people around the area. She works seven days a week. She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are thieves and transportation. Formerly, Zam was aspiring of going directly to villages for charcoal and now she is aspiring to educate her children up to university. 

Zam resides in and owns a four-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mrs. Then Yoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Then Y. is 38 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the 20 group members who are located in Samar Khmaer village in Takeo province. Each of the members of this village loan will use for a different purpose. Mrs. Then Y. is a silk weaver and a fruit seller. She is able to earn a small income to support her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Hakk Sann, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to increase their income to improve the famiL.'s standard of living, Mrs. Then Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and to build a pigsty for pig breeding. This couple has three children who are students and help in their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets and build a pigsty

loans.name: Tofuola

texts.en:
Tofuola N. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (fabric clothing covers). Tofuola needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tofuola joined SPBD.This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tofuola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is a 39-year-old lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is married with five children aged 14, 11, 8, 5 and 3. She lives with nine people in her home. She says for now, her family resides in staff quarters since she is a teacher at one of the schools around town. Her husband is also a teacher.

Clare operates a brick-making business which she started early this year. She hopes to do commercial brick-making on a large scale.

Clare hopes to construct her own house for her family’s residence. The purpose of the loan is to buy building materials for completion of her house aimed at generating income from tenants.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completion of her house aimed at generating income from tenants

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer from the town of Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been practising mixed farming for the last 30 years. Her farm produces milk, bananas, tea and coffee which she sells at the local market. She depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family.

Mary is 51 years old. She is married with 5 children who are now between the ages of 16 and 30. Her youngest child is still attending school.

Mary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her child. She faces the challenge of lack of enough capital to expand her business.

In five years' time, she would like to expand her farm in order to increase her sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jashon Ochola

texts.en:
Jashon O. is 33 years old , a business man who sells water at the Nyalenda estate in Kisumu town. He is married to Stella Anyango who also sells water and contributes to the family income. They are blessed with two children ages three years and five years old. Jashon has been in this business for one year, and his monthly income is Kshs.10,000

O. is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to open up another water kiosk. He plans to use the anticipated income to pay back his loan.

loans.use: To open up another water kiosk

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 57 years old and widowed with four adult children. To make a living, Merlita runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erika Del Carmen

texts.es:
Erika es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica a la venta de su propio negocio, la venta de cuajadas, tortillas, enchiladas, frutas. Para poder ayudar a sus padres, anteriormente trabajaba en una librería, pero renuncio y esta mas enfocada en su negocio, que atreves del financiamiento espera aumentar de inventario para poner a la venta mas producto rico, que llamen la atención del cliente.
También los fines de semana hace sopa, tacos oh vigoron,  para vender y poder ganar. Como objetivo es poder crecer un poco más.
Es por eso con este crédito comprara: granos básicos, pollo, carne, frutas, verduras y golosinas para lograr el aumento de inventario. Está contenta por poder seguir adelante con su inversión que gracias a la institución lo está logrando.
texts.en:
Erika is a small trader, who engages in selling cuajadas (a dessert made of curd cheese), tortillas, enchiladas and fruits in her own shop. In order to help her parents, she had started working in a book shop, but she then stopped and is now more concentrated on her activity; thanks to the loan she hopes to increase her stock to be able to sell more tasty products that will attract more customers.
In the week-ends she also prepares soups, tacos and vigorón (a typical Nicaraguan dish made of vegetables, marinated chile, boiled yucca and friend pork wrapped in plantain) to sell them and earn some more. Her goal is for her activity to grow a little bit more.
For this reason with the loan she is requesting she will buy: basic grains, chicken, meat, fruits, vegetables and sweets to augment her stock. She is happy to be able to keep on running her activity thanks to the loan this institution is about to grant her.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, chicken, meat, fruits vegetables and sweets to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es:
Rubia reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 48 años y vive con su esposo y sus hijos, juntos desarrollan el trabajo de siembra de maíz y chile ya que su esposo desde niño practica este oficio siendo el ingreso con el que cuentan para mantenerse y cubrir sus gastos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues desean sembrar en esta época y no cuentan ni con el dinero ni con los materiales para el cuido del cultivo, Este préstamo ayudara a realizar las compras necesarias y que la siembra reciba los cuidados necesarios para su buen desarrollo.
Su proyección es obtener una buena cosecha y poder comercializarla para obtener los ingresos y solventar sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Rubia resides in El Transito area of San Miguel.  She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children. Together they work to grow corn and chile as her husband has done since his childhood.  This is the income they maintain themselves upon and cover expenses.
She has requested a loan for the purchase of compost and fertilizer, as they want to sow this season and have neither the money nor the materials to the care of the crop. This loan will help to make the necessary purchases and ensure the planting care necessary for the crops proper development.
She anticipates a good harvest and to market it for the income to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy compost fertilizer to plant corn and chiles

loans.name: Oswalda

texts.es: Oswalda tiene 50 años, es separada, viven con sus tres hijos en su casa propia, ella es una mujer muy luchadora, es así que poco a poco ha logrado construir su casa. Oswalda posee una tienda, siendo su única fuente de ingreso y por tal es la que más temprano abre para el público, debido a que madruga para ir al mercado mayoristas y poder abastecerse de verduras y frutas frescas para  su negocio, ya que son alimentos no perecibles y de lo que tiene mucha demanda como el pan de cada día. A media mañana no le queda mercadería alguna, y eso le da mucha satisfacción, por lo que le resulta rentable su trabajo. Además de esté trabajo, también se dedica a vender queques y gelatinas que ella misma prepara. Lo que mas le gusta negocio, es conversar con sus clientes, además tiene víveres que no logra vender lo cual lo utiliza para el menú familiar. Es así que lleva 6 años en esta actividad y lo que considera más difícil es cargar las bolsas de compras, ya que sufre de lumbalgia. En adelante tiene planeado construir el segundo piso de su casa. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, para no traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar alimentos de primera necesidad, para que su bodega esté provista de diversos productos y que sean del gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oswalda is 50 years old.  She is separated and lives with her three children in her own home.  She is very much a fighter and as a result she has managed, little by little, to build her own home.

Oswalda owns a store which is her sole source of income and, for that reason, hers is the store that opens earliest to the public.  She gets up very early in the morning to go to the wholesale market in order to be able to stock her business with fresh fruit and vegetables as they are perishable foods for which she has a lot of demand.  By mid morning she has no merchandise left and this makes her feel very satisfied and means that her work is very profitable.

In addition to this work, she also sells cakes and jellies (jell-o) which she makes herself.  What she likes most about her business is chatting to her customers and also the fact that the provisions which she doesn't manage to sell she uses for her family's meals.  She has been in this business for 6 years and the most difficult thing about her work is packing shopping bags since she suffers from lower back pain.  In the future she is planning to add a second level to her house.  This is her ninth loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in her repayments in order to avoid making things difficult for her community bank.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy basic foodstuffs so that her store is stocked with a range of products which will please her customers.

loans.use: To buy basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion B. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 42 years old. Asuncion is married and has four children. To make a living, Asuncion owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Asuncion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in her farming business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Asuncion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in farming business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Rosita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She is also engaging in buying and selling of coconuts. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Perling

texts.en:
Perling P. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 68 years old. Perling is single and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Perling owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Perling has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perling joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perling has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. Perling is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods & instant noodles. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Perling from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia Y. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general store), buying and selling dried fish and a computer games business. She lives in Brgy. Pandan, Bogo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her NWFT loans and by her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Lilia is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Lilia hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es: La señora María Teodora M. V. desde hace varios años se separo de su esposo y quedo a cargo de sus 4 hijos por lo que ha salido adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda para tener mas espacio y vivir con mayor comodidad. Para esto requiere comprar material de construcción para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria Teodora Medoza V. separated from her husband several years ago, which left her in charge of her 4 children.  She has exerted herself to provide a better quality of life for them.  Right now, she wants to build a room onto her home so they will have more space and live more comfortably.  That's why she wants to buy construction materials to do this project.

loans.use: Begin construction

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 47 years old. She is a widow and has one child who is 29 years old. Donatha sells different foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes, cabbages, cassava and Irish potatoes. Donatha has done this business for 24 years and it has enabled her renovate her house and expand it as well. 

Donatha is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs, which she hopes will give her more profits. She plans to save her profits up to the point she can build a small house in which she could rear some chickens.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves F. is from the village of Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 49 years old. Nieves is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Nieves owns & operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of different meals like adobo & afritada to customers in the local community. Nieves has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nieves joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nieves has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Nieves is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients like meat & vegetables & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nieves from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional raw ingredients

location.town: Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 42 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل سائق لنقل الطلاب والسواح له في عمله 13 سنة يحب عمله ويريد من خلال العمل الى تطوير نفسه فهو متجدد ومحب للعمل والنشاط يريد ان يزيد مدخوله حتى يستطيع تأمين العيش الجيد للأولاد وان يدخل مصلحة جديدة له كي تعيله على تخطي مصاعب الحياة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بقرة والاستفادة من بيع الحليب واللبن وغيره من مشتقاتها والاستفادة منها بزيادة مدخوله
texts.en: Mohammad is 42 years old and married with five children. He works as a driver for students and tourists. He has worked in this capacity for 13 years, and he likes his work. He would like to develop himself through his work, as he is forward-thinking and loves working, as well as being active in generA.. He would like to increase his income in order to be able to secure a good life for his children and to help himself overcome the various difficulties in his life. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, Muhammad would like to buy a cow so that he may increase his income by selling the dairy products that the cow will produce.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase the family income

loans.name: Carlos Kleber

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre trabajador que tiene un pequeño bar de comidas rápidas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que el inicio el bar de comidas porque no tenia trabajo. 

En la actualidad vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas, sanduches, bebidas, snack,  desde muy temprano comienza el labor en su negocio hasta la tarde. Tienes muchas aspiraciones de continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comenzar con un préstamo para comprar snack y así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hardworking man who manages a small fast food eatery.  He started the snack shop when he was unemployed, and aspires to steadily grow his business. 

Carlos sells all kinds of fast food, sandwiches, drinks and snacks.  He starts early in the morning and stays open into the evening.  In order to expand his sales, he seeks a loan to increase the variety and quantity of his stock of snack foods.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for a snack shop

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Ngor Group 1

texts.fr:
Apec Al Ouma groupe 1 est une association de 13 femmes qui habitent dans la même localité de Ngor et appartiennent a la même association Al Ouma. Le groupe 1 est membre du guichet de Ouakam depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 2 200 000 frs. Les membres du groupe évoluent toutes dans le secteur du commerce(vente de produits locaux, fruits de mer,poissons, légumes, tissus,petit déjeuner ou diner,et d'autres produits divers). Elles pratiques des activités séparées.
Elles sont représentées par madame Ndiaply S.. Elle exerce la vente de produits locaux et de fruits de mer. Elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi son activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi éviter le chomage. L'argent emprunté a renforcé ses fonds de roulement pour l'achat des produits locaux et fruits de mer pour revendre.

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients
texts.en:
Apec Al Ouma Group 1 is an association of 13 women, all living in the same district, Ngor, and members of the same Al Ouma association. Group 1 has been a member of the Ouakam credit union since July, 2010. The group is asking for a loan of 2,200,000 francs. The group members all work in commerce (selling local products, seafood, fish, vegetables, fabric, breakfast, dinner or other consumer products). Each member operates her business independently of the other group members.

They are represented by Ms. Ndiaply S.. She sells local produce and seafood, building on five years’ experience in the business. She chose this work in order to earn income to help meet her family’s needs and to avoid being unemployed. The borrowed funds will reinforce her working capital for buying local produce and seafood for resale.  

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has expanded its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members. Members typically put in $2 per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: to purchase local produce and seafood

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 67 years old, married to Drusilla B., and the father of three children aged 18, 16 and 14 years old. Benjamin raises livestock on his farm mainly for milk production and has been supplying the milk to the nearby Kcc for a period of 20 years earning a monthly income of about $125.

He has applied for a loan of  40,000 KES and hopes to use this money to improve the farm and purchase two dairy cows. This is his 4th loan after successfully servicing his previous loans. 

The profits will be used to educate his children and to add more livestock to his farm. He desires to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Albeiro Arleyson

texts.es:
Albeiro es un microempresario que desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a vender frutas y verduras en diferentes negocios ubicados en el municipio de Yarumal en el departamento de Antioquia, pues la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia lo obligaron a conocer la ley del rebusque desde niño, lo que lo ha fortalecido y le ha permitido convertirse en un hombre luchador que a pesar de las dificultades ha querido superarse y salir adelante. 
 
Hoy a sus 25 años emprende un su propio negocio, una legumbrería que le ha dado la oportunidad de ser independiente y generar ingresos para su familia, Albeiro trabaja todos los días de 5:30 de la mañana a 8:00 de la noche y aunque su jornada es larga, Albeiro considera que sólo bajo los principios de responsabilidad, emprendimiento y dedicación puede lograr materializar su sueño de convertir su legumbrería en un supermercado que ofrezca a sus clientes gran variedad de productos y poder construir así su casa propia. 
 
Actualmente Albeiro quiere que su legumbrería cada vez tenga más clientes y como estrategia pretende surtir gran variedad de productos y hacerle algunas adecuaciones a las instalaciones del negocio, para ello necesita de un préstamo debido a que sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir dicha inversión.
texts.en:
Albeiro is a small businessman who, from a very young age, has sold fruits and vegetables in different businesses located in the town of Yarumal, in Antioquia Department. Because of the difficult economic situation his family went through, from childhood he had to learn the law of hard work, which has strengthened him and has allowed him to become an enterprising man who, despite difficulties, has wanted to excel and get ahead in life.
 
Today, at 25 years old, he is setting out to run his own business, a fruit and vegetable store which has given him the opportunity to be independent and generate income for his family. Albeiro works everyday from 5:30 am until 8:00 pm, and although his workday is long, Albeiro believes that only with responsibility, an enterprising spirit and dedication can he make his dream come true, the dream of turning his fruit and vegetable store into a supermarket that offers his customers a large variety of products so he will be able to build his own house.
 
Right now Albeiro wants his fruit and vegetable store to have more and more customers, and as a strategy he intends to stock a large variety of products and make some changes to the premises. To do this, he needs a loan because his income is not high enough to cover such an investment.

loans.use: to stock his fruit and vegetable store and make changes to the premises

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Née en 1973, Martine est mariée à Michel un mécanicien Auto. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à charge. Martine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Martine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Martine n’a jamais été à l’école et a appris le métier de couture, un métier qu’elle exerce il y a près de trois ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Martine vend divers produits (lait, sucre, etc.) dans son atelier. Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Martine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  deux premiers crédits dont Martine avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Martine is married to Michel, who is an automobile mechanic. The couple are raising four children, all enrolled in school. Martine lives with her husband and children. She and her husband share in supporting their family. 

Martine never went to school and learned to be a seamstress, a trade she has been working in for nearly three years. At the same time, she sells various products (milk, sugar, etc.) out of her workshop. She buys her merchandise in a market in Bénin. This business brings in money to help support her family. 

With a view to boosting her business and increasing her profit, Martine is requesting her third loan from ALIDé. Her first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions and various items (sugar, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Migyera Development Group B

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Leo says being steadfast in his belief that he would make headway in his carpentry business was his watershed moment. The happily married father of six says having that courage of conviction set him off in many ways. He believed in his own worth and also had a sense of diligence. This was key as he embarked upon his entrepreneurial venture 10 years ago, having undergone apprentice carpentry training before he even thought about establishing the business. This is a far cry from the story of most carpenters in Kihihi who acquire skills on the job.

Leo primarily makes wooden chairs and windows, earning a weekly profit of shillings 140,000. He also does some small scale farming. With this Kiva loan, Leo says he is going to purchase more timber to make more wooden products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase  more timber to make wooden chairs and windows to sell.

loans.name: Flor Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4  hijos de 20, 17, 12 y 7 años de edad, todos aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio ya que es fundadora del banco  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy ordenadas y cumplidas con sus obligaciones.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para sacar a sus hijos adelante en este mundo tan difícil se dedica al comercio, vende detergentes, desinfectantes, jabón, cloro, entre otras productos. Ella contrata vendedores a quienes les paga un sueldo, ellos ofrecen los productos puerta a puerta, también vende en su casa sobre todo a vecinos y comerciantes a quienes les vende a mejor precio por que comprar mayor cantidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene que recibir o entregar los pedidos. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más productos como cloro, detergentes, desinfectantes, jabones, etc.
 
Sus sueños son tener una distribuidora a nivel provincial.
texts.en:
The members of the "Nueva Estrella Solidaria" (New Star Solidarity) Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi.  The city has been known for many years as the City of the Reales Tamarindos.

Here we met Flor, 39 years old and a single mother of 4 children, 20, 17, 12 and 7 years old.  They are all still living with her and study in colleges and schools.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning as a founder of the bank.  She likes it because her partners are very organized and fulfil their obligations.

Flor is a housewife raising her children is this difficult world.  So she works selling detergents, disinfectants, soap, and chlorine, among other products. She hires salespeople who are paid a salary, and they sell products door to door.  She also sells from her home, mainly to neighbors and businesses, to whom she gives a better price as they buy larger quantities. Flor works every day from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and sometimes even later when she has to receive or deliver orders.  She has been dedicated to this activity for 4 years and is doing very well.

Flor will use the requested loan to buy more products, such as bleach, detergents, disinfectants, soaps, etc. Her dreams are to have a distributor at the provincial level.

loans.use: to buy chlorine, detergents, disinfectants, soap etc.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
She is 22 years old and married. Her husband is a student. She has one child. 

She is currently in the business of selling fruit, like tomatoes, pineapples and apples and is requesting a loan to expand her small business.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her husband's university fee.

loans.use: to expand her small business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos (1 independiente).  Mercedes no cuenta con estudios.
Desde hace seis años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de comidas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará chuño, papa, occa, queso, trucha, carne, refrescos, azúcar, etc.  Nos cuenta que prepara thimpo, trucha frita, queso frito (comida típica de la región).  En el negocio le ayuda su hija y vende todos los días.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia donde pueda instalar un pequeño negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el compartir con las socias y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the communal bank "Medalla Milagrosa", meaning "Miraculous Medal". It is located in the district of Pomata in the province of Chucuito in the department of Puno. She is 55 years old, a single mother, and she has 4 children (1 is independent). Mercedes did not have the opportunity to go to school.

She has been working with the support of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past six years. Her initial loan was in the amount of S/ 300 nuevos soles and the funds were invest in her food sales business.

With this new loan, amounting to S/800 nuevos soles, she will purchase chuño (a freeze-dried potato product), potatoes, fingerling potatoes, cheese, trout, meat, soft drinks, sugar, etc. She tells us that she prepares thimpo (a traditional stew), fried trout, and fried cheese (a traditional food of the region). Her daughter helps her with the business and she makes sales every day.

Her dream is to have a house of her own where she would be able to set up a small business.

What she appreciates about her communal bank is the meetings where she is able to share with the other members and she appreciates the interest earned on her savings.

loans.use: to purchase chuño (a freeze-dried potato product), potatoes, fingerling potatoes, cheese, trout, meat, soft drinks, sugar,

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a young single man and does not have any children yet. He operates a shoe sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been running this business for the last four years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to increase his stock of shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future and move to a bigger premise in the Nairobi Central Business District. He describes himself as honest and focused.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Chiedza Group

texts.en: This is 35 year old Fikelephi from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is married with six children, four of whom are attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Fikelephi runs a transportation business. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenges faced are high repair costs due to unavailability of spare tires. Fikelephi has requested a loan of $400 to purchase spare tires and tools. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her dependents to school and improve the family's quality of life. In the future Fikelephi plans to have a larger fleet of commuter buses.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare tires

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, de 52 años, es una mujer optimista, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos; Nataly y Ángel con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todos los días, desde las primeras horas, sale a pastar a los animales que comercializa; ya que es su principal actividad comercial. Ella posee, 3 toros, 7 vacas,  varias cabezas de ovejas y 3 novillos pequeños que gracias a los cuidados que le brinda a diario podrán crecer fuertes y saludables. Según cuenta le va muy bien pues ella misma siembra el pasto que comen sus animales. Está muy contenta, ya que ahora 3 de sus vacas están apareadas. Cuando sus animales están aptos para ser comercializados, los ofrece en el camal de su localidad. Sin embargo Sabina cuenta, que en temporadas de invierno, cuando las vacas poseen más leche, ella aprovecha y elabora queso, el cual comercializa juntamente a la leche sobrante. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades, pero esta actividad solo lo realiza una vez al año. Para más adelante, desea apoyar en su hija Nataly en la especialización de su oficio de cosmetóloga. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde todo este tiempo que integra su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha de apoyar en el surgimiento de sus socias. Además agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes, por ello promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Sabina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “única” y “tomaza”, además de fertilizantes naturales y semilla de avena para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 52, is an optimistic woman and a single mother of two children, Nataly and Ángel. She and her family live in their own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. Every day during the first few hours, she lets out her animals to graze. Selling these animals is her main business activity. Sabina owns three bulls, seven cows, several heads of sheep, and three small heifers. Thanks to the care she provides, her animals are able to grow to be strong and healthy. According to Sabina, she has been just as successful in growing fodder to feed to her animals. She is pleased now that three of her cows have been impregnated. When her animals are fit to be sold, they are offered to the local slaughterhouse. During the winter season when the cows produce more milk, Sabina says she takes advantage of this time to make cheese, which she sells along with any remaining milk. In addition, she plants potatoes of all varieties but she only does this once a year. Going forward, she wants to support her daughter Nataly as she pursues a career in cosmetology.

Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is her fifth loan with MFP. Every time she is with her group, she can feel the support emerging from all of the other members. In addition, she is grateful for everyone’s support so she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the support she will receive, Sabina plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of three sacks of potato seeds of the “Única” and “Tomaza” varieties. She will also buy natural fertilizers and oat seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of potato seeds, fertilizers, and oat seeds.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 46 years old and married to Jomer. They have been blessed with five children. Two are still attending school, and the rest already have their own families. Magdalena and her husband raise crops to generate income. They plant and harvest rice. They usually harvest the rice twice a year, with each harvest earning them a minimum of 30,000 PHP.

As of now, Magdalena has insufficient funds to support all of her family's needs, especially the daily needs of her children. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in faming.

In the future, Magdalena would like to generate more income to support her family and somehow improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou habite dans la region sud senegal ,depuis 5 ans,elle fait de la coiffure dans son propre salon.Mariée depuis 2005 sans enfant,avec son metier ,elle arrive a soutenir sa mere pere,avec se credit elle veut  acheter de nouveaux produits pour augmenter son stocks et ainsi developper son activitesalon. Elle travaille avec trois de ses apprenties et avec ses benefice elle pense acheter un terrain dans le futur.
texts.en: Fatou lives in southern Senegal. She is a hairdresser and has had her own salon for 5 years. She has been married since 2005 and has no children. She uses her income to support her parents and will use this loan to enlarge her hairdressing salon so that it can accommodate her and her 3 apprentices. She would like to save the profits from her business so that she can eventually buy her own land.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.es:
L. señora fidencia cuenta con 58 años D. edad, está casada con el señor amado con quien tiene 8 hijos, D. los cuales ya todos están casados y han hecho su vida aparte, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. carnes y quesos, desD. hace mas D. 18 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y L. educación D. sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su forma D. vida y contar con una solvencia económica, y así poder vivir más cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas carne y quesos.
El anhelo más granD. que tiene doña fiD. (ya que es como mejor L. conocen  sus amistades), es el D. poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y algún día tener una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, para así incrementar un poco mas sus ganancias y ahorrar una parte, por cualquier problema que llegue a atravesar. 
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad, por todo el apoyo y L. confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio. “GRACIAS”
texts.en:
Fidencia, 58, is married to the man she loves, with whom she has eight children, all of them married with their own lives.  She has been selling meats and cheeses for more than 18 years.

She says she started this work because she wanted to support her husband with the household expenses and their children's education.  She also wanted to improve her way of life a little and depend on economic solvency, and so be able to live more comfortably.

She is going to buy more meat and cheeses with the loan she received.

What FiD. (as her friends know her best) most desires is to be able to make her business grow even more, and some day have a little grocery store so she can increase her profits a bit more and save some for any problem she happens to encounter.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for all the support and trust they are offering her, since her life and her business have changed thanks to the support received.  "Thank you."

loans.use: to buy more meat and cheeses.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a resident and farmer in Litein. She has been in poultry farming for  6 years producing eggs, milk and tea and selling them to the local market. She is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 2 years.

Lona has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry to expand her poultry farming. She says the loan will help boost her business through the experience she has gained running it for 6 years.
 
She says farming challenges remain fluctuating market prices and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Sokyoeurn

texts.en:
Sokyoeurn (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Bunthai is 41 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have one daughter who is in school.  The family is living in a village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Sokyoeurn has been running a grocery store for five years, while her husband is a construction worker.  She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to fill in the land behind her house because there is a pond behind it that she needs to fill in.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house.

loans.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es: Patricia, nuevamente está solicitando un nuevo crédito, porque necesita invertir  más  y mejorar en su negocio de productos esotéricos  como: talismanes, velas, lociones, esencias, el propósito de ella es ofrecerles a los clientes más variedad y buen producto. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a fortalecer más su negocio, este avance le permitió mejorar económicamente y siempre mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en: Patricia is requesting a new loan because she wants to invest again in her business, and improve it with arcane products such as: talismans, candles, lotions and essences.  Her goal is to be able to offer her customers a variety of good products.  Her previous loans helped her to strengthen her business.  This advance will allow her to have a better economic situation and keep her business stable.

loans.use: to buy talismans, candles, lotions and essences

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 23-year-old married woman. She has two children between the ages of 1 and 3.  One child is in school. She has had a business for a year selling food from a stall in Yei, South Sudan.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava flour and simsim (sesame seed) to sell. She will use the extra income she gets as a result of this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and simsim (sesame seed) to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single parent with one child. She is a petty trader at Besease near Elmina and has been in this business for the past five years. Comfort is responsible for the upkeep of her child. She will use her loan to buy more goods for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luciana;  La socia tiene 55 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos son independientes y 3 de ellos tienen 30, 28, 22 años de edad; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo animales menores, la socia compra y cría ovejas, cuyes, gallinas, la socia también vende comidas caseras, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cuyes la socia compra en esta época desde 18 hasta 30 soles la unidad de cuyes; estos dos meses subió todo así que ella comprara en dos partes primero un grupo  y después de dos semanas comprara otra tanda, lo mismo hará en el caso de las gallinas desde 12 soles hasta 45 soles dependiendo el tamaño y como esta época subió todo, ella tendrá que ver los tamaños. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de gallinas y cuyes en dos partes. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO” Communal Bank, which is located in Ccorao district, in Calca province and Cusco department. Sra.Luciana is 55 years old, married and has five children. Two of her offspring are independent and three of them are 30, 28 and 22 years old 

Luciana works buying and selling small animals; she buys and raises sheep, guinea pigs and chickens. She also sells home-cooked food. She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs. At present she pays between 18 and 30 soles per unit of guinea pigs. During these two months the price increased so that she will buy them in two stages: first she will buy one group and after two weeks she will buy another series. She will do the same with the chickens, which are from 12   to 45 soles, depending on size. As prices all rose during this period, she will have to see the sizes.
