She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs in two stages.

Luciana is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs in two stages.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Maritza; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de pan, la socia elabora diferentes panes y los vende en la plaza principal del poblado aprovechando la llegada y parada de los buses, combis y autos particulares que descanzan para seguir el camino a las ciudades de Arequipa, Puno, Puerto Maldonado. La socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de insumos para elborar los diferentes panes.
texts.en: This borrower is Maritza. She is continuing with her business of selling bread. She makes various kinds of bread and sells them in the main plaza of her town. She takes advantage of the fact that buses, vans and private cars arrive and stop there before they continue on the roadway to the cities of Arequipa, Puno, and Puerto Maldonado. She would like to invest the loan in buying supplies to prepare the various kinds of bread she makes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make various kinds of bread.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Mery se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas y también vende comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda donde expende sus productos. Mery requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, cerveza y gaseosas.

El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mery is 38 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has two children. She was born in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco and she now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Mery makes a living selling beer, soda and foodstuffs. She has a small store where she sells her products. Mery needs this loan to buy commodities such as sacks of rice, beer and soda.

The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" consists of responsible, hard-working people who help their families get ahead. The majority of its members live in the city of Cusco, where they carry out their business activities. Cusco is renowned for being a tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi and because it is located near to one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu".

loans.use: to buy commodities such as sacks of rice, beer and soda.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is 29 years old and married with three children. For over ten years, Malik has owned an art and design business where he designs T-shirts. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to supply the vast market.

His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes in future to buy land for crop growing. He intends to use the loan to buy T-shirts and chemicals.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts and chemicals for his art shop.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Frezia  mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de 8 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos desde hace 5 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en comprar mercadería como pantalones, camisas, shores, faldas, vestidos, trajes de niños, y sandalias de diferentes estilos. Mayra mujer de 45 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa y Ivania mujer de 37 años y  su negocio es la venta de comida y ropa.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of them is Frezia, a 36 year old woman, who is married with an eight year old son. 

For the past five years she has run a businesses selling cosmetics. She has been a member of the group for one year. 

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, children's clothes and sandals in different styles. 

Mayra, 45, sells clothes and Ivania, 37 sells food and clothes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, children's clothes and sandals in different styles.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana Marcela es una mujer de 28 años que  tiene  a cargo dos hijos de  cinco y dos años de edad, a los cuales ha tenido que brindar un buen futuro, sacrificando muchas cosas, como no poder estudiar, trabajar más de  ocho horas diarias para poder llevar un buen sustento a la casa; todo esto se debe a que  el padre no se ha hecho responsable  de todo lo que representa el cuidado y amor, ya que para a él primero esta  los amigos y el trago.
Ella alcanzó a convivir  dos años con Álvaro el padre de los niños, pero él siempre se encargó de darle  mala vida, duraba hasta tres días sin  llegar a la casa, no traía nada para comer, no ayudaba a pagar el arriendo, ese comportamiento de irresponsabilidad se debía a que tenía otra señora, pero Diana  descubrió todo lo que él estaba haciendo y decidió que lo mejor era la separación. 
Pero a ella no le importa, ya que sabe que puede salir adelante sola y sin necesidad de la ayuda de el, prefiere vivir sola que aguantarse un esposo que es lleno de problemas.
Hace 6 meses tuvo que renunciar porque  tuvo un ataque de nervios y fue tan fuerte que perdió el control y cayó en la depresión, los hijos estaban muy sorprendidos y tristes por lo que estaba sucediendo, ya que siempre llevaban en la mente la imagen de que la mamá era una mujer luchadora e incansable.
Este problema se desató ya, que no tenía quien cuidara a los hijos, y no quería que corrieran peligros, ella tenia bastantes problemas en la casa y con ella misma, que en momentos pensó que no tenia salida de todos estos, pero un día el hijo mayor le dio un fuerte abrazo y le dijo que la amaba porque era la mejor mamá del mundo, ella se quedó mirándolo fijamente a los ojos y le sonrió, y le prometió que lucharía como siempre lo ha hecho para que no les faltara nada.
Al día siguiente, se reunió con una amiga  y le comentó la dificultad que tenia, ella le dijo que “con la ayuda de Dios nada  faltará” y le ayudó a conseguir trabajo con un amigo, este trabajo que le consiguieron lo podía realizar en la casa, y así poder estar pendiente de los niños.
En este momento Diana no está en la mejor situación económica ya que hasta hora consiguió trabajo y los gastos de ella sola y los niños es un poco complicada, pero ella no quiere abandonar la idea de terminar este técnico de Administración En Salud ya que ella siente que es una gran oportunidad para que ella pueda terminar de estudiar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a los hijos.
texts.en:
Diana Marcela 28, has two children aged five and two for whom she has had to provide a good future, sacrificing many things such as not being able to study and working more than 8 hours a day in order to earn a living. 

All of this is due to the father who has not been responsible for anything that represents care and love. To him the most important things are his friends and drinking.   

She lived with Álvaro, father of the children, for two years, but he only caused problems. He would not come home for up to three days in a row, he wouldn't bring any food home, he didn't help pay the rent. This irresponsible behavior was because he had another wife. However, Diana found out about everything and decided the best thing was to separate. 

But she does not care, since she knows she can get ahead by herself without his help. She prefers living alone than putting up with a husband who is full of problems.  

Six months ago shes had to quit because she had a nervous breakdown which was so strong that she lost control and fell into a depression. 
The children were very surprised and sad over what was happening because they always had the image of their mom being a fighter and a tireless woman. 
The problem got worse since she had none to take care of the children but she didn't want anything bad to happen to them.  

She had a lot of problems at home and with herself and at moments she thought there was no way out. But one day her oldest son gave her a big hug and told her that he loved her because she was the best mom in the world. 

She stayed looking at him firmly in the eyes and smiled at him and promised that she would fight like always and that he would have everything he needed. 

The following day she met up with a friend and told her what a difficult time she was having. Her friend told her that "with God's help she would lack nothing" and she helped her find a job through another friend. 

She was able to do the new job they found her at home and in this way she could take care of the children. 

Currently, Diana is not in the best financial situation since it took her a while to find a job and alone taking care of the expenses for her and the children is difficult. 

However she does not want to give up on the idea of becoming a medical administrative technician. She feels this is a great opportunity for her to finish her studies and in this way give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Maria Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda is a very hard-working woman and together with her partner has five children. She used to work in a company which produced clothes. Some time later she had to assist her children and needed to leave her employment, so she talked to her boss and he proposed that she could continue working from her house and produce clothes for the company. That is the way as she began her business more than one year ago. She bought two sewing machines and with them started her business.

Today she requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise and sewing straight line machine, which will help her to perform her job with better quality and efficient way. Herlinda requests a term to pay her loan of 3-6 months.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Herlinda es una mujer muy trabajadora y junto con su pareja han procreado cinco hijos, ella acostumbraba trabajar en una empresa en que se maquilaba ropa, pero debido a que tenía que atender a sus hijos fue que tuvo la necesidad de dejar su empleo y al comentárselo a su jefe, este le propuso que siguiera trabajando, pero ahora desde su casa y maquilándoles ropa a la empresa. Fue así como inició su negocio hace mas de un año, comprando dos maquinas para coser domesticas, con las cuales empezó el negocio de la maquila de ropa.

Hoy en día requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 USD para la compra de mercancía y una maquina de coser recta, la cual le ayudará a realizar su trabajo con mas calidad y de manera mas eficiente. Herlinda solicita un plazo para pagar su préstamo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and sewing straight line machine

loans.name: Wilbad

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 3. I sell sugar cane for a living. I intend to use the loan to expand and diversify my business so as to enable me to pay school fees for my children with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch S. is 43 years old. She is a mother of eight children and lives with her husband in Preyveng, Cambodia. Uch is a housewife and grows some crops on her farm. Her husband is village chief and can usually make around $4/day in revenue. One of her children, meanwhile, works at the nearby garment factory and contributes all her wages to the household. The other children are students and assist their parents with works when they leave school. Uch hopes to use the loan to purchase rice seeds to grow on her farm and the rest is used to for farming tools. 
In the future, S. wants to expand her business by owning a piece of land to grow more rice and a variety of crops .

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to grow in her field.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Mrs. L. is married with five children. She has sold vegetables for eight years. She wants to expand her stand inventory by carrying a larger quantity and variety of vegetables such as lettuce, carrots, cucumbers, potatoes, etc. Since she has started selling vegetables, she has become capable of providing the basic needs for her family, particularly food, and now does not need to wait for her husband to pay for all the financial needs of the family.

Mrs. L. is a member of the group “DIEU EST BON” in which three people want to receive a loan of $125 each. The total loan solicited by the group is $375.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.fr:
Carmen is 49 years old, married and has two children who help her tend her business. She has owned a small grocery and diner for 12 years.

She indicates that it was very difficult in the beginning, because she started out with a small kiosk selling only beverages and ice cream. Thanks to her family's help she was able to move ahead; her husband always helped her and other relatives even loaned her money to stock her small store. Today Carmen runs a well-stocked store and a diner where she serves all kinds of fast foods.

Carmen feels very fulfilled, because her business is growing and her main helpers are her children, who wait on customers and deal with vendors. One of her short term goals is to put the finishing touches on her house, such as flooring and paint; she also wants to help her chidren finish their studies so that they'll have access to better job opportunities.

Carmen tells us that this business allowed her to buy her own home, support her family and keep her children in school. She also credits the loans she received through the Paraguayan Foundation with helping her expand her business. She's requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as meats, milk, beverages, wine, sugar, yerba, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen tiene 49, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ellos ayudan a su madre a atender el negocio. Carmen posee una despensa y comedor, desde hace más de 12 años. Comenta, que su inicio fue bastante duro ya que empezó con un pequeño kiosco, con venta de bebidas de todo tipo y helados, pero gracias a la ayuda de su familia pudo salir adelante ya que su marido en todo momento la ayudaba e inclusive algunos familiares le prestaron dinero para comprar mercaderías para proveerse de capital. Hoy día Carmen posee una despensa bien surtida y un comedor donde vende distintos tipos de comidas rápidas. Ella se siente realizada ya que su negocio está creciendo y sus principales colaboradores son sus hijos, quiénes se encargan de la atención y de las compras de sus proveedores. Uno de sus objetivos a corto plazo es terminar su casa ya que actualmente aun le faltan pequeños detalles como piso, pintura, y por supuesto es seguir ayudando a sus hijos a que culminen sus estudios superiores, esto les permitirá tener oportunidades de acceder a un buen trabajo. Comenta que gracias a su negocio pudo comprar su casa propia, mantener a su familia y ayudar a sus hijos a capacitarse, también dice que los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le ayudo bastante a hacer crecer su negocio. Ella desea hoy un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías como carne, leche, bebidas, vino, azúcar, yerba, etc.

loans.use: to purchase meats, milk, beverages, wine, sugar and yerba mate

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
"I have some unfinished construction due to lack of money. But now, things are a bit better and I would like to finish construction so I can live in these rooms. I just need some flagstone. I seek a loan of $1000 to finish my construction. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción si terminar ya que me falto dinero pero ahora me he recuperado un poco y quisiera terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos solo me falta la losa. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción."

loans.use: Finish construction and layout of flagstone

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en: Baroat A. is a 51-year-old woman with two children who lives in the town of Spitamen. After receiving her first loan in 2004, she proved herself to be an extremely capable and enthusiastic businesswoman who was able to find a solution to any problem. She also always makes her loan payments on time, which is why we are pleased that she has come to us for a new loan to once again expand her business and, with it, her income.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elva Elisa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elva started a business of selling jewelry and shoes with the intent of earning extra income to be able to cover her household costs and the education of her son. This has provides her with good income and does not take all her time, allowing her to attend to her other duties and the care of her son, keeping him out of any trouble.

Elva wishes to buy merchandise in wholesale quantities for a lower cost. For this reason she is requesting a loan of USD $375, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy shoes wholesale and offer better prices to her customers as February 14th approaches. With your help she will be able to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elva inicio el negocio de venta de joyería y venta de calzado con el propósito de tener un ingreso extra, para poder mantener los gastos económicos en su hogar y de la escuela de su hijo. Esta actividad le ha dejado buenos ingresos y aparte no le dedica todo su tiempo ya que le permite realizar otras actividades y no descuidar a su hijo para que no se meta en malos pasos.

Elva desea comprar mercancía de por volumen de mayoreo para poder obtener un costo más bajo. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elva podrá comprar por mayoreo los zapatos y así poderles dar un mejor precio a sus clientes ya que se acerca el 14 de Febrero. Con tu ayuda Elva podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
"I am a widow and my name is Nazira H. U.. I was married 25 years ago and since then I have been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan. I am the mother of eight. All of my daughters are married and all of my sons embroider clothes. My sons want to buy threads, beads, and sequins in bulk and for this purpose we require a loan. Wedding season is around the corner and during this season, my sons can obtain bigger orders.

I would like to borrow in a group: Jameela B. wants to improve their restaurant; Khalida B. will invest her share of our loan to buy a rickshaw; Nabeela B. will also invest her loan in her husband’s business; and Azra B. is borrowing for her husband’s shoe business."

loans.use: expand our embroidery business

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
My name is Jameela G.. I am from the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four children, all of whom attend school except the youngest, who is not of school age yet. My husband is a daily wage laborer and earns very little, which is insufficient to meet our household expenses. Therefore my husband has decided to start a fruit cart on a nearby bus platform. He hopes this will increase our income substantially. There are four other women in my loan group who are in need of loans. Sakina is acquiring a loan for her son, who has a motorbike business. Rukhsana B. will use the loan to improve her family's restaurant. Shamim needs this loan for her husband, who is a butcher. Shamshad requires the loan for her husband's electronics repair store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and we are mutually responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: Start a fruit cart business

loans.name: Advija

texts.en: Advija, a widow and the mother of 13-year-old twins, was born in 1963 and lives in Hlapčevići, a small village near the town of Visoko.  She and her mother together receive a monthly pension of 560 KM.  Advija will use this loan in the amount of $825 to buy chickens in order to expand the existing business and help her family with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda launched her business after her divorce, when she took the initiative to take on a short course of study and get a job to pay for her family's living expenses in order to give her two children a better life. This is what led Esmeralda to go to beauty school and open her own business. Eleven years ago, she began giving haircuts and doing dye jobs. As her clientele has grown, she has been able to begin offering additional services.

Today, Esmeralda needs a $250 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a wider range of dye colors so that she can earn more money. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Esmeralda inició el negocio a raiz del divorcio, tomo la iniciativa de estudiar una carrera corta y conseguir un empleo para solventar los gastos familiares y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos, fue asi que se decidio a estudiar belleza, y depsues emprendio su negocio. Comenzó hace once años empezo haceindo solo cortes de cabello y aplicaciones de tintes; poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes y esto le permitio ir brindando mayores servicios.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para tener una gama mas amplia de tintes y obtener mas ganancias para la estetica. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase more colors of hair dye

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia P., 72, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in selling pigs. She sells to the public and villagers 5 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (~158 USD).

SPBD loans are Telesia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Telesia will also use the loan money for home improvement. She would like to buy cement, timber and iron for the roof. She has children who are working and living overseas and they help her out with family needs.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment for repairing the fence for her business

loans.name: Thi Yen

texts.vi:
Just like many other families in Phu Minh village, Mrs. K. Thi Yen's family relied mainly on farming and raising a small number of livestock to earn a living, because she did not have enough capital and her children were still small. In 1994, the TYM Fund expanded to Phu Minh village and she became one of the members. Her first loan was 300.000VND (about 20USD) to purchase 3 pigs to breed, which yielded a small profit. Over the years, she continued to borrow to expand the pig sty and purchase more chickens, pigs and geese to breed and sell to other villagers. She also reared pigs to sell to butchers. Every year, her annual income from raising livestock and poultry was about 40,000,000VND (about 2667USD). Currently, she has 200 pigs and hundreds of chickens, geese and ducks. Her family's economy has improved tremendously thanks to the loans through the TYM Fund. Her family has become the model of raising livestock in Phu Minh village. Mrs Yen hopes that the TYM Fund will continue to reach out and provide help for the poor who do not have enough capital to improve their quality of life. This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150USD) to invest in raising livestock and poultry. Her family's average monthly income is 7,000,000VND (about 466USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Cũng như bao gia đình nông dân khác trong xã Phú Minh, gia đình chị Khổng Thị Yến chủ yếu làm ruộng và chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ, bởi chị không có vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi và khi đó các con vẫn nhỏ. Năm 1994 Quỹ bắt đầu triển khai ở xã Phú Minh và chị là những thành viên tham gia đầu tiên của xã, vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 300.000 đồng mua 3 con lợn về chăn nuôi và năm đó cũng đã cho thu nhập ít nhiều. Qua các năm chị vẫn tiếp tục vay vốn của quỹ để mở rộng chuồng trại và mua lợn, gà , ngan giống về chăn nuôivà bán con giống cho người dân trong vùng, đồng thời chị còn nuôi lợn thịt. Mỗi năm thu nhập từ chăn nuôi lợn , gà , ngan cũng được khoảng 40.000.000 đồng. Hiện tại trang trại chăn nuôi của chị có khoảng 200 con lợn thịt và hàng trăm con gà, ngan, vịt, kinh tế gia đình chị có được như ngày hôm nay là nhờ đồng vốn của Quỹ và đi lên từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà ...gia đình chị là một điển hình về chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế của xã Phú Minh. Chị mong muốn Qũy sẽ phát triển không ngừng và luôn giúp đỡ những người nghèo khó có vốn để phát triển kinh tế như gia đình chị.Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising livestock and poultry

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat S. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells frozen foods both  wholesale and retail. Apart from this shop where she sells frozen items, she also has a shop in the market where she sells smoked and frozen fish. Kudirat has been in this business for the past 26 years. She needs a loan of $ 425 to buy more cartons of frozen foods for sale. Kudirat says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods for sale

texts.es:
Maria Concepción vive actualmente en la zona primero de mayo en la  ciudad de el Alto
 
Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja cpomo carpintero y sus tres hijos de 6, 4, y 2 años respectivamente .

Trabaja en una empresa de exportadora de prendas de vestir de lana como tejedora,. 

Posee un terreno en una sona periferica , que fue cedido por su madre en cual  realizara la construccion de una habitación y mejoras del terreno.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria Concepción currently lives in the May First area of the Alto city. She lives with her husband, who works as a carpenter, and her three children, ages 6, 4, and 2 respectively. Maria works in an exportation business, which sells clothing such as wool. She owns a plot of land in the outskirts of the city, which was given to her by her mother. On this land, Maria would like to build a house and improve the terrain. This is her first loan experience with Impro, as she was recently qualified as a loan recipient.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a house

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani Baji is married to Mr. Khalil and lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan, loacted near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Rani Baji owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 10 years. She has three children: two sons and a daughter. None of her children go to school. Rani Baji’s husband runs a milk-sales business: he chose this profession 15 years ago, learning from his parents who are also involved in the dairy business. Rani Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She has successfully re-paid her two previous loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a new loan to buy an additional buffalo to expand her husband’s milk sales business.

Rani Baji is borrowing together with a few other people from the local community: Sharifan Baji, who needs a loan to buy bricks for sale, Safia Baji, who will use the loan money to buy milk cream to sell to grocery shops, Hafizan Baji, who wants to borrow to be able to buy a buffalo for her milk sales business, and Zareena Baji, who needs additional capital to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are held equally responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en: Wilhelmina A. started her local restaurant twenty years ago in Ashaiman, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 56 years old and married, with three children who are currently in school. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, banku, and ampesi among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and it is eaten with any stew. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Wilhelmina hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called The Voice Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and support one another to repay. Wilhelmina is in the photograph taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn has been living at Brgy. Malamag East Tumauni, Isabela since 2000. She is married to Edgardo who is an expert house carpenter. They are blessed with three children aged thirteen, twelve and three.

She set up a small village store in 2004 and her husband started their furniture shop in 2006 in order to augment their income. The skills of her husband as a carpenter has been a great advantage to their shop because the furniture they make like wooden cabinets, dining set, chairs and tables are being sold easily. Currently, they are thinking of getting a loan of PHP5,000 as their additional capital. It will be used in buying various products to be sold in her store and the needed materials in their furniture making business like soft wood.  

When they have enough savings, they plan to have their house repaired and of course to further improve their business. But foremost in their dream is to see their children finish college.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell in her store and materials needed in the furniture shop

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. Brigida is a 54-year-old widow and has three children. Brigida travels to different regional fairs, where she sells clothing, dry goods and other special order items.  Brigida needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sweaters, aprons and skirts.  Brigida’s dreams are to open a general store with a wide variety of merchandise in a fixed location. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Brigida es viuda, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Brigida viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa típica, abarrotes y todo cuanto le piden. 
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, mandil, faldas. 
Los sueños de Brigida son abrir una tienda surtida y con local estable.

loans.use: Buying sweaters, aprons and skirts

loans.name: Yenni Guisela

texts.es: Yenni Guisela H.  reside en San Ramón en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Desde hace ya tres años, vive con su esposo quien trabaja fuera de casa como obrero, la familia vive en casa alquilada, pues sus dos hijos pequeños, les causan demasiado gastos como para podes hacerse de una casa propia. Su hijo de 5 años ya  asiste al kínder , y el más pequeño tiene tan solo tres meses. Yenni ha montado en su casa un salón de belleza, donde trabaja todos los días y para incrementar sus ingresos lo ha surtido con diversos artículos como relojes, carteras, perfumes. Con el sueño de poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, Yenni y su esposo solicitan un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprando productos que ayuden a vender más, pues les es necesario establecer una base económica solida, que brinde un respaldo en la futura crianza y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yenni Guisela H. lives in San Ramón in the district of Cuscatlán, and has lived with her husband for three years. He works outside the home as a labourer, and the family lives in a rented house. With two small children they have too many expenses to be able to own their own home. Their five year old son is in kindergarten, while their younger son is only three months old. Yenni has set up a beauty salon at home, where she works every day. To increase her income she has diversified into selling other items including watches, wallets and perfume. With the dream of being able to offer her sons a better future, Yenni and her husband are seeking a loan to invest in the business, buying products that will help them to make more sales. It is important for them to establish a solid economic base that offers support for raising and educating their sons in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in a beauty salon

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. sells drinks, and she has been in this business for long time. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja hace 6 años, y es madre de 4 hijos que viven en su casa. Desde pequeña Norma se dedicó a la agricultura, conoce a la perfección los trabajos de la chacra, y cuando iba con su esposo a trabajar como peón para otras personas notó que sus compañeros a la hora de almorzar solo bebían gaseosa con un pedazo de queque. Fue entonces que les propuso prepararles el menú y llevárselos a la chacra, sus compañeros alegremente dijeron que sí. Desde entonces su esposo trabaja en la chacra y Norma se dedica a preparar los menús a las 5.00am para que el desayuno esté listo a las 8.00am en la chacra, el almuerzo a las 12.00pm, y termina su labor llevando la cena a la 6.00pm. Norma está muy contenta, jamás imaginó en convertirse en una experta cocinera y más aun que le resultara tan rentable que nota que con esos ingresos está mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Norma siempre tuvo anhelos de trabajar en un banco comunal y ahora que integra este grupo, colabora en todas las actividades, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de víveres, y eso le permitirá a variar su menú diario para todos sus comensales.
texts.en:
Norma is 35 years old, has lived with her husband for 6 years and is the mother of 4 children who live at home. Since she was a little girl Norma has worked in agriculture. She knows farmwork very well, and when she and her husband went to work in the fields she noticed that at lunchtime her co-workers only had a soft drink and a piece of cake. It was then that she came up with the idea of making meals and taking them to the fields and her co-workers happily agreed. Since then, her husband works in the fields and Norma prepares meals starting at 5:00 am so that breakfast is ready at 8:00 am, lunch at 12:00 pm and she ends by bringing dinner at 6:00 pm. Norma is very happy, she never imagined that she would turn into an expert cook and that this would turn out to be so profitable that with this income her childrens´ standard of living would improve. Norma always hoped to work with a communal bank and now that she has joined this group she is collaborating in all activities and commits to making all her payments on time. The money she requests will be used to buy supplies, which will allow her to vary the daily meals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for preparing meals.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili P., 33, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the public 6 days per week. Lili is asking for a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to support her business. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Lili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy pancake ingredients

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
Ebrahim has owned a clothing shop since 2006. When he first started his shop, the 2006 war broke out which forced him to close his shop for a while. He lost some of his merchandise and he had to redo the décor and purchase new merchandise. He has passed through some hard times and faced a critical financial situation since he put all his savings into the shop.

Ebrahim's clients can be anybody. Ebrahim chose this business because he wanted to work independently. He is 50-years old and lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Ebrahim has requested a loan of $3000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a clothing shop

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Qadir R. is a young farmer of 25. He has three years of experience in this field. He is married and has one daughter. Qadir raises and breeds calves in the small village of Agsu City. He fattens his calves and later sells to local traders. Qadir requested a $1,200 loan to purchase two baby calves.

loans.use: Purchase two baby calves to expand his business

loans.name: La Familia Renacer Grupos 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Aida has been making curtains in her home for the past fifteen years. She has a small shop in the front of her house which is located on a bustling corner of Santiago. Her business has served as supplementary income and has helped put her three children through school.

She is seeking now to expand her business by offering various housewares and women's fashion accessories (such as shoes, handbags, etc.), in addition to her custom curtains. The loan will serve as capital for her to expand her product line. The income from Aida's business goes to help support her family.

loans.use: To add housewares and women's fashion accessories to her inventory

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Frida es conviviente, tiene 59 años y 8 hijos, Frida vive en la comunidad de Viñaca a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde compra y vende tara, cochinilla y lo vende a intermediarios. Además Frida vende leña en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Frida necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Frida son mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos, nietos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 59-year-old with a live-in partner and 8 children. She lives in the Viñaca community, located 45 minutes from the city of Ayacucho, where she buys and sells tara pods and cochineal insects, then sells them to intermediaries. Additionally, she sells firewood in the city of Ayacucho.

Frida needs a 2,600.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase tara pods.

Frida dreams of improving her business and providing an education for her children and grandchildren so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tara pods

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito H. is 42 years old, married with 3 children and is a resident of Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental, Philippines.

She needs additional capital to increase her purchasing capacity so that with more fish to sell, she can expand her business and increase her profits and ultimately save enough money for the education of her children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has owned and operated a fish vending business for the past 3 years.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. All four of her children are currently in school. She sells corn and cassava dough in the community market. Corn dough is milled maize grain mixed with water and used to prepare local meals like banku, kenkey and porridge. Cassava dough is also milled cassava mixed with water. Cassava dough is mostly added to corn dough to prepare banku. 

She hopes to raise income to support her husband with providing a better education for her children. She wants to use the loan to buy more cassava and corn dough to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cassava and corn dough in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food items and staple goods

loans.name: Haidee

texts.es: Haidee tiene 44 años, es una mujer luchadora y muy admirada por sus vecinos, vive en su propia casa junto a su hija Maria de 22 años, a quien le ha sabido dar una buena profesión y es su principal apoyo para mejorar su calidad de vida. Es negocio de Haidee es la venta por campaña, vende según la temporada y tiene un gran “olfato” para saber qué es lo que más compra la gente. Ahora se encuentra distribuyendo por los puestos de mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), bolsos juveniles traídos desde la ciudad de Tacna, ya que ha visto que son las prendas que están de moda. Lo que más disfruta de su trabajo es llevar cosas novedosas a sus clientes, lleva 13 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es saber cuál seria un buen producto para vender. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los productos que trae desde distintos lugares del país y del extranjero. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará su mercadería para aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Sulaiman's Group

texts.en:
N. Sulaiman is the leader of his all-youth group in Mukono. He is a determined and hard-working man with a fishing job of 25 years plus owning a retail shop in Bunankenda.

At first he was only fishing the waters of Lake Victoria until he saved some little capital that enabled him to open up a retail shop for increased income. From the shop alone, he is able to make weekly profits amounting to 50,000/=, though he still has a challenge with some of his customers taking goods on credit and taking too long to pay their bills.

At the time when he is busy in his shop, he is helped by his wife although she also has a farming business. Sulaiman says that the secret to his success is the self-administration that he has managed to pass on to his children, wife and group members. He needs a loan to help buy more stock for his retail shop: sugar, beans, maize seeds, groundnuts and many other things, since this the season for cultivation and farmers need seeds.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more products

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert M. is 57 years old. He lives in Sevan with his wife and son. The whole family contributes to his business, which consists of preparing and selling confectionery. Three years ago, Albert developed a spot in the yard of his own home as a place for his business. Before that, he worked as a builder in Russia. He decided to return to his native land and start his family business. His production is now very popular in the entire Gegharkunik region. The main business centre is located in Albert’s hometown, Sevan town. Albert provides many shops and school buffets with his product. He has difficulty delivering his product to such a vast region. Albert wants to take a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a car in order to provide his customers with his fresh products, on time.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport his products to his customers.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon B. lives in the village of Taguilon. She is 44 years old, married, has five school-aged children and makes a living by fishing. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two loans from PMPC, and is now applying for a new loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to help pay for her children's education.

PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Neri Verónica

texts.es:
Neri M. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua quien desde muy temprano se esfuerza por llevar a cabo su tarea de venta de las verduras donde es visitada por los clientes en el mercado.

A pesar que ella no posee un local eficiente para llevar a cabo su actividad, ha buscado la manera de como vender más para así continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar. Es por este motivo que solocita un crédito para la compra de las verduras como lo son tomates, papas, chiltomas, chayotes y otros. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente en su actividad.
texts.en:
Neri M. is a hardworking woman who sells vegetables at the Israel Lewites Market in the city of Managua. She begins her day very early so that she can go about selling vegetables to all of her customers who visit the market.

Despite not having an efficient location to carry out her business, she has found ways to sell more produce and continue sustaining her household. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, bell peppers, chayote, etc. Her business will greatly benefit from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchae vegetables

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som P., 55, is married with a three-year-old child. He resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with his wife and daughter (pictured). To make a living, he works in the agriculture sector, raising livestock such as pigs and ducks. In addition to raising livestock, P. grows fruit trees. With his two businesses, he is able to generate an income of $2.5 USD per day as the primary source of family income. P. is asking for a loan of $800 USD to purchase pig food and medicine to protect his pigs from disease. This is his first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy pig food and pig medicine

loans.name: Juntos Trabajando Group

texts.es:
EMPRENDEDORES Y TRABAJADORES, ELLOS VIVEN EN LAZONA D. AÑO NUEVO EN ELDISTRITO D. COMAS.
NIRA , INTEGRA ÉSTE GRUPO DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS, TIENE 66 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES VIUDAD Y TIENE 8 HIJOS TODOS MAYORES D. EDAD QUE LA APOYAN EN SUS PROYECTOS.
ELLA SE DEDICA HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 15 AÑOS S LA VENTA D. COMIDA RÁPIDA, EN UN CARRITO SANGUCHERO QUE LO UBICA TODAS LAS NOCHES EN LA PUERTA D. SU CASA.
INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO D. POCO EN POCO, CON LA IDEA D. APOYAR EN LOS GASTOS D. LA CASA, SIN TENER QUE DESCUIDAR A SUS MENORES HIJOS, ES POR ESO QUE CON LOS AHORROS QUE PUDO JUNTAR COMPRÓ SU CARRITO SANGUCHERO Y EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR, LUEGO D. UNOS MESES PUCO IMPLEMENTAR UN ESPACIO EN SU CASA PARA COLOCAR MESAS Y PODER ATENDER CON MAS COMODIDAD A SUS CLIENTES.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS D. SUS NIETAS QUE ESTUDIAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, Y ASI DAR EL EJEMPLO A SUS HIJAS DEL TRABAJO Y ENSEÑAR FUNCIONAMIENTO DEL NEGOCIO.
LE AGRADARÍA MUCHO PONER UN RESTAURANTE  E INGRESAR AL NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA D. ALMUERZOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS ALPOR MAYOR,  PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Entrepreneurs and workers, they live in the Año Nuevo region in the Comas district. Nira has been a member of this group for three years. She is a 66 year old widow, and she has eight adult children who support her in her projects. For approximately 15 years she has been selling fast food. She sells from a street cart, which she places in the door to her house every night. She started her business little by little with the idea of helping with the household expenses without having to neglect her minor children. With the savings she was able to get together, she bought her street cart and started to work. Then, in a few months she was able to set up a space in her house to put tables. That way she could wait on her customers more comfortably. With her work she has been able to pay for her granddaughters’ university education. This way she sets a work example for her daughters, and she teaches them how the business works. It would really please her to set up a restaurant and start the business of selling lunches. The loan she is asking for is to buy supplies wholesale for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en: Boaz O. is a 53 year old man, married and blessed with 8 children. Boaz used to run a bakery before he ventured into dairy farming. Boaz is a proud owner of 3 dairy cattle, which is an achievement in his local area; this is because farmers in this part of the country are widely known as sugarcane specialists. He takes his milk daily to the nearby town of Butula, Busia District. He says he will use this loan to expand his dairy shed and prepare more feed since one of the cows is pregnant and due to deliver soon. Boaz would like a loan of KShs. 30,000.

loans.use: To expand his dairy shed and buy more feed

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Diana es conviviente, tiene 19 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Diana vende cosméticos por catálogos, también vende ropa a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, Diana por las tardes estudia contabilidad en la Universidad.
Diana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos y ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Diana son tener una tienda de ropa y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank.

She is 19 years old, in a stable relationship, and expecting her first child. Diana sells cosmetics from a catalog. She also sells, upon request, clothing items which she offers her friends and family members. Afternoons, she studies accounting at the University.

Diana needs a loan of 600 New Sols to invest in purchasing polo shirts and underwear. Diana's dreams are to have a clothing store and to complete her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POLO SHIRTS AND UNDERWEAR TO SELL

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Rosa, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un restaurante chicharronería en su casa propia y vende el tradicional plato desde hace varios años, nuestra socia también vende otros platos para variar un poco el menú entre los caldos que son sopas de pollo, gallina, el chairo, entre los secos está la trucha frita o al horno. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su local desea mejorar su negocio, comprando unos estantes nuevos, y adornos como cuadros y un poco de vajilla.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Ahorro Es Progresso – Saylla” (Saving is Progress). He lives in the District of Saylla, which is located 30 minutes away by bus from the city of Cusco. Saylla is well-known for its open air restaurants, where people can come to enjoy the scenery while savoring a delicious Peruvian meal. The specialty of the city of Cusco is “chicharrón” (a dish containing 3 or 4 pieces of pork with roasted potatoes, sweet corn, or onion and herb salad).

Rosa is 43 years old, married, and has two children (ages 11 and 7). She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. She manages a chicharrón restaurant in her home and has been selling this traditional specialty for several years. In addition, she serves other dishes to add a little variety to her menu ranging from soups and stews to chicken and trout (either fried or baked).

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to improve her business. She will purchase new shelves, decorations such as paintings, and some cookware. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shelving, decorations, and cookware

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años y es madre de 04  hijos, 01 que  aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, la socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Otilia es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido cumpliendo algunos de sus  metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta de ropas usadas y le esta yendo muy bien, en este tipo de actividad, ya que tiene clientes fijos que la conocen y saben de su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar muy bien acondicionado. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará mercaderías de ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logro y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Otilia Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria
texts.en:
Otilia belongs to the Las Aguerridas II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 51, married, and has four children. One child is still dependent upon her and goes to school. She has a high school education. Otilia is very happy, persevering, and capable. She tells us that, little by little, she has been reaching her goals and dreams. She currently sells clothes, and it is going very well for her. She has regular customers who know her and know about her business. The business is located in her house in a well-equipped area. Her characteristic strength and perseverance helped her to grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of what she has accomplished. She will use this loan for 800 PEN to buy merchandise like pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses in all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and dresses for girls. She feels very proud of herself for what she has achieved, and she did it with a lot of enthusiasm and optimism. Otilia says, “I am grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement offers me, to be able to have loans that help me to develop as a woman and a small businesswoman.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like pants and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo T., 47, is married with five children living at home in the Takeo province. She makes and sells Khmer cakes, typically making US $3 each day and her husband grows rice and some vegetables to sell at the market. Her husband, Chhem Sokkum, typically makes about US $3 each day as well. Bo T. would like a loan of US $800 to purchase baking supplies.

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies.

loans.name: Aleyda Del Pilar

texts.es:
este cliente es originario de la cuidad de telica,se desempeña en el cargo de docente y labora en el instituto señor de esquipulas telica, ha obtenido 10 creditos los cuales los ha utilizados en desarrollo personal,
pago de modulos universitarios de hijos y para mejoramiento de vivienda
texts.en:
This client is originally from the city of Telica. She serves as a teacher and works in the Señor de Esquipulas high school in Telica. She has obtained 10 loans, which she has used for personal development, paying for her children's university studies, and improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a toilet, cement, sand, and pay for work

loans.name: Lidia Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia C. se dedica a elaborar tortillas en el Mercado Iván Montenegro en Managua donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella elabora las ricas tortillas y son puestas a la venta para que sus clientes las lleguen a comprar.

Ella actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de materia prima como maíz, carbón y leña y por tal razón solicita el crédito para así proceder con la elaboración de las tortillas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia C. works making tortillas in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. She goes there very early every morning to prepare the delicious tortillas and sell them to the customers who come to buy. Currently she needs to purchase basic ingredients such as corn, coal and kindling. That is why she is requesting the loan- to continue making the tortillas in her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coal, kindling and corn

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badegna, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Gonido sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des condiments alimentaires et céréales à l’image de Koumba D..
Ces femmes du groupe Badegna sont à leur quatrième prêt tout comme Koumba qui compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de céréales.
Elle s’approvisionne le plus généralement à Fana et environs  auprès des producteurs et effectue sa  vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Badegna group are all married, average 33 years of age and four children each, and live in traditional extended families in Gonido, Fana sub-prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family connections. Their trade is selling food condiments and cereals, as Koumba D. does it, for example. This would be the fourth loan for each woman in the Badegna group, just like for Koumba, who plans to use this loan to purchase bags of cereals. She usually buys her stock in and around Fana from farmers and sells from home, at the Tingolé market or at the fairs in the region, retail, for cash, and on credit, to a customer based composed of both women and men. She plans to obtain a monthly income of 15,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards daily family expenses, and the rest reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cereals (for resale)

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Tienda y Miscelánea M & J es un negocio que iniciaron Pedro G.  y su esposa Ruth María, hace 6 años y pulso a pulso; gradualmente ellos lo han visto crecer desde que se vinieron de Chibolo Magdalena a comenzar una nueva vida en el municipio de Soledad ; primero iniciaron con un pequeño ventorrillo en Ciudad Camelot  y luego compraron con sus ahorros un lote que han ido construyendo y donde trasladaron  su ahora tienda -misceláneas  que unió  las dos actividades realizadas por los esposos : él en su venta de víveres ranchos, bebidas y ella la de sus mercancías que vence mediante catálogo, la cual ha crecido gradualmente y ahora ocupa un puesto en la tienda grande de su esposo, que solicita a la Fundación  un crédito para surtir la miscelánea y comprar mercancía, como ropa calzado, suéteres  para vender en poblaciones del Magdalena.
Pedro G. aprendió a negociar con su mamá una mujer ejemplar y muy comerciante, hoy con su cónyuge Ruth María, también negociante, ha avanzado y tienen además de esta tienda miscelánea, venta de minutos, servicio de internet y fotocopiado y venta de mercancía al detalle como ropa, calzado, camisas para damas caballeros, niños y niñas, que envían a  los  pueblos  de Plato y Chibolo, ambos en el Departamento del Magdalena.   
Pedro ha notado que su negocio ha crecido con los créditos que le ha facilitado la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde ha recibido 3, ello se ve reflejado en una mayor infraestructura de equipos y enseres, en la adición de nuevos servicios, la capacidad de pagar un ayudante y  especialmente de adquirir la mercancía “sin agonizar con créditos costosos”; esta familia sabe para dónde va y tiene un gran entusiasmo con su negocio, porque Pedro dice, que le ha dado a su familia todo, y que en él hasta sus hijos menores quieren participar y se lo permiten algunas veces, sin abandonar sus tareas escolares,  porque son excelentes estudiantes y los estudios son su ùnico compromiso.
Su sueño es  continuar construyendo su vivienda  y comprar un carro para ahorrarse los costos de transporte diario de sus negocios,  que suman más de $ 500.000 mensuales, su mayor desafío es tener siempre efectivo disponible para comprar de contado cuando llega las mercancías que necesitan sus clientes
texts.en:
“Tienda y Miscelánea M & J” is a general store started by Pedro G. and his wife Ruth María six years ago. Little by little they gradually watched it grow until they came to Chibolo Magdalena to begin a new life in the community of Soledad. At first they started with a small tavern in the city of Camelot and later they used their savings to buy a lot upon which they built. They were able to unite the couple’s two careers: his, selling provisions and drink and hers, selling merchandise via catalogue. The catalogue business gradually grew and now occupies an area of her husband’s big store. He is soliciting a loan from the Fundación in order to replenish the store’s stock of clothing, footwear, and sweaters which he sells to Magdalena’s population. Pedro G. learned about business from his mom, an exemplary woman and very business oriented. Today with his wife Ruth María, also a businesswoman, he has advanced and has in addition to the general store, a business providing services such as internet and photocopying. Pedro has noticed that his business has grown with the 3 loans provided by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He has been able to improve the infrastructure of equipment and furnishings. He now has the capacity to offer new services and pay an assistant. Perhaps most importantly, he is able to acquire merchandise “without agonizing over expensive credit”. This family knows where it is going and has a great enthusiasm for their business because, as Pedro says, it has given his family everything. His young sons want to participate and he occasionally allows them to help, as long as it doesn’t interfere with their homework. They are excellent students and school is the one thing he will not compromise. His dream is to continue to build his home and buy a car in order to save on the daily costs of transport for his businesses which can amount to more than $500.000 a month. His major challenge is having enough ready cash available to buy in bulk when the merchandize that his customers need arrives.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, underwear, clothing, shoes and sweaters.

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: Sulma tiene 51 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y esposo en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica en la adquisición de animales a precios muy bajos del mercado, para luego cebarlos durante 4 meses y venderlos a un precio alto. Ella ha demostrado ser un excelente negociante, su facilidad de palabra y capacidad de convencer logra realizar una buena venta, de cuyas ganancias le ayuda para sostener a su familia. Sus hijos la ayudan en el trabajo, luego que terminar de hacer las labores del colegio. Con el pasar del tiempo, su capital de trabajo aumentó y eso le da tranquilidad y satisfacción al ver el buen trabajo que realizó, ya que el bueno cuidado en la alimentación e higiene de sus animales ha logrado este desarrollo. Su mayor anhelo es tener cantidad de animales para no dejar de trabajar y aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, por tanto continuará siendo muy responsable como lo fue siempre, además considera que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una vaca de buena raza  con la que pretende vender leche mas adelante.
texts.en:
Sulma, 51, lives with her five children and her husband in her own house. For over six years she has raised farm animals that she buys at low prices in the market and sells at higher prices after keeping them for four months. She has shown herself to be an excellent negotiator. Her sales skills and ability to convince her buyers allow her to make good sales the profits of which help her support her family. Her children help her with her chores when they finish their school work. As time has passed, her working capital increased and it gives her satisfaction and peace of mind to see the fruits of her labor because it’s thanks to the good care in feeding and hygiene that her animals manage to develop so well. Her greatest wish is to have a larger herd so that she will always have work and her income will increase. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she will continue to be as responsible now as she’s been to date; she feels the funding will be very useful for her business to succeed. She will use the requested funds to buy a cow of a good breed in order to go into milk production and sales later on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and go into milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Truck repairs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita Q. is a 46 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a pig fattening business. She lives in Barangay Jantianon, Amlan, Negros Oriental with her 52 year old husband Rico and their 6 children who are between 9 and 23 years old and are all currently going to school. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. Teresita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could continue her pig fattening business. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn E., 25, believes that dreaming is not only meant for wealthy people. Being poor and having limited access to many services that would enhance her standard of living, has not tempered her optimistic view.  With her loving and supportive husband who is a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver, she is determined to make her dream of improving her family lifestyle, especially for her two children come true. 

Her husband's tricycle is very old and not reliable and this impacts their family income.  Lorelyn would like a loan to finance the repairs needed for the tricycle.  She cannot run a business right now because her children are very young (two years old and seven month old).

With loans through ASHI, Lorelyn hopes to one day purchase many tricycles for a transportation business.  By then she would need drivers to operate the vehicles. She would help many unemployed men in their village as well as their families.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle spareparts and pay for tricycle repair.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ann S. 56 years old and she is the village bank president having been selected by fourteen members which located in Puothi Reamea, Kandal province. With the loans, the member of this village will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose.   
Mrs. Ann S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and peanut for a living.Aside from farmer she is also pig breeder at home who is able to earn a little income to hold up her family living. In order to support this agriculture, she will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy pig food for pig breeding and to buy rice seed for cultivating rice. Mrs. Ann S. is widow with a child, who is a cloth seller in the local market.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding and to buy rice seed for cultivating rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses.

loans.name: Kasharara Bakyara Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
In a certain village of Bwera, Ibanda there is a determined lady named T. Christine, aged 39 years, a go-getter businesswoman who has been dealing in general merchandise in a retail shop. This stickler for hard work is also a married mother of 3 school-going children and has been running her business for over 2 years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business. In a month, her business generates a profit of 240,000 Ugandan shillings. 

This to all intents and purposes is a low figure. What has helped her as she operates her business have been her exceptional customer relationship skills. Now, she is taking a long view with an aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in handy in helping her buy more stock as currently she sells small household items like sugar, soap, and so on.

loans.use: buying more stock  like sugar, salt, soap and many other items for resale

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: D. amah  est une dame de 54 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce charbons de bois et s'approvisionne à anié à l'intérieur du pays. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003. elle demande un premier crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 20 sacs de charbons de bois pour pouvoir satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Amah D. is a 54 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She runs a business selling charcoal and stocks up in Anié, in the interior of the country. She has run her business since 2003. She is requesting this first loan in order to stock up with 20 bags of charcoal so that she may be able to satisfy the needs of her clients.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old, separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda M. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: Nipa (palm leaves), pig fattening and fish vending. She lives in Prk. Toril, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Nipa, pig-fattening and fish-vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Erlinda is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can use it as additional capital. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Erlinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending-team page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Don Roberto, es un señor trabajador con espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a ser un comerciante con mucho movimiento, tiene 50 años de edad y reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia, el movimiento de su negocio se da porque ofrece la mercadería en su vehículo y se transporta a los pueblos cercanos buscando clientes para vender  sus productos; él transporta Maíz, Mariscos y Ropa, ofreciendo de todo un poco su único impedimento es que se le terminan los fondos para volver a invertir por este motivo él Solicita un préstamo que le ayude a solventar esta situación, su propósito es aumentar los inventarios de cada producto que ofrece.
El objetivo como comerciante es proporcionar a los clientes lo productos que necesita es por eso que ofrece varios artículos en su vehículo, para su familia él tiene como objetivo propiciar los ingresos necesarios para su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Roberto is a hard working person with an entrepreneurial spirit. He is a merchant with a great deal of energy. He is 50 years old and he lives in Jiquilisco, in the community of Usulutan. He lives with his family. He is very mobile in his business because he distributes his goods in a car and visits the near-by villages in search of clients to buy his products. He transports corn, seafood and clothing. He sells a little bit of everything with his only obstacle being that he runs out of capital funds to reinvest. He requests a loan to help him with this situation. His goal is to increase his merchandise products for resale. 

As a merchant he endeavors to provide his clients with the products that they need, which is why he sells various products from his car. For his family, he wants to generate enough income to provide for their well-being and their development.

loans.use: To purchase corn, seafood and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic groceries

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen R. de 60 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se esfuerza día con día por salir adelante. Ella vive en Jiquilisco, en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su hijo mayor de edad, el cual le ayuda con el negocio. María posee un comedor, en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa jugos, fruta, y golosinas. Desde hace 6 años que ella posee su negocio el cual esta ubicado en la zona de alimentos en el mercado regional de Jiquilisco, en donde sus ventas son muy estables, y las cuales le permiten contar con todo lo necesario para vivir. María solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos como: granos básicos, verduras, frutas y otros más, todo con el enorme deseo de aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: María del Carmen R., age 60, is a very hard-working person, who strives day to day to get ahead.
