She lives in Jiquilisco, in the Usulutan department, with her grown child, who helps her with the business. She has a canteen, where she makes breakfasts and lunches, and also sells juice, fruit and candy. She has had this business, located in the food zone of the regional market of Jiquilisco, for six years. Her sales are very stable, and they allow her to have everything necessary to live. Maria is requesting a loan with the goal of buying a larger quantity of basic materials for making food, such as: basic grains, vegetables, fruits and other items. She has a great desire to increase her sales.

loans.use: The purchase of basic material for making food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cooking oil

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Mercedita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like sardines, milk fish & salmon,  in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like boboron & tamban. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie G. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: dry goods (clothing) and Internet. She lives in Prk. Carpo, Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,500. For her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlie is now borrowing PHP 20,000 in order to purchase more clothing stock to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlie hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Fedie

texts.en:
Fedie P. is from the city of Ozamiz. He is 30 years old, married and has one school-aged child and two infants.

Fedie owns and operates a transportation business. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In December 2010, Fedie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

Fedie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to pay for his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle

loans.name: Russie

texts.en:
Russie owns a little shop selling various consumable items. Russie is 40 years old, married, and has two children, aged four and eight. Both her children are enrolled in school. 

 Russie sells consumables such as sugar, maize flour, rice and many more, which she has been doing for two years. Her husband is a driver.  Russie will use the loan to increase the capacity of her business through adding new products to her inventory.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Russie plans to further upgrade her business to offer better services to her customers. She would like to have a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Twenty-nine-year-old Robert would like a loan to cultivate land. He has been a maize farmer for the last four years and his dream is having a food store. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda in a semi-permanent house. His desire  is to put up a permanent house and educate his children.

loans.use: Cultivating land

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Just like her fellow community partners in CCT*, Paulina A., 58, is determined to get only the best in life. One disappointment she has was not going to college; now, she is firm in her decision not to have any more major regrets in life. 

Paulina is married to Carlos, a supervisor. They live as a family in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

Paulina runs her own sari-sari (variety) store in their community. She has done so for five years, and her neighbors already are familiar with how she conducts her business. Paulina wants to know what her customers want and aims to meet those preferences. She carefully chooses her products and sells them attractively, earning around 10,000 Philippines pesos (PhP) per month.

Knowing that she needs more finances to keep her business growing, Pauline applied for a Php12,000 loan. She plans to use this to purchase essential goods, such as shampoo, soap, instant noodles, biscuits, and drinks, which her regular customers typically look for. The loan helps in leveraging the profitability of her store and allows her to pay their bills and buy what her family wants.

Tough competition within the vicinity, low sales at certain times of the year, and unpaid debts by some customers are just a few of the problems Paulina has. But she refuses to let these hurdles keep her from obtaining the best she could have. She holds on to her dream of acquiring their own lot, building their own house, having a bigger store with wholesale products, and buying their own car.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchasing salable items for her store

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 44 سنة متزوج يعمل في مطعم لبيع الفول والحمص وهو طعام لبناني يحب عمله له خبرة كبيرة في هذا العمل له في عمله 10 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساعده في تطوير نفسه وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع منزله وتطويره حتى يصبح في مستوى معيشته
texts.en: Hussein is 44 years old and married. He works in a restaurant selling Lebanese food such as fuul (beans) and hummus. He loves his work and has 10 years experience in this. He has good credit history with A. Majmoua and previous loans helped him to develop his business further. He has the full support of his family. With this loan he wants to improve and renovate his house so that it may be suitable to live in.

loans.use: to renew and renovate his house to make it suitable for living in.

loans.name: Segundo Vicente

texts.es:
Segundo de 63 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad repartiendo pollo por su sector. Luego se expandió hasta la aurora donde es su mercado de trabajo.

 El empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano diariamente en la repartición de pollos en cada sector donde está ubicado. Una de su dificultad del trabajo es la delincuencia ya que es frecuente por la sola. Con préstamo quiere comprar pollo, huevos, balanceados para aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere tener una avícola.
texts.en: Segundo is 63 and works hard distributing poultry products in his neighborhood. He has expanded his business to include the la Aurora area market as well.  Working from early morning and often alone, one of the hardships Segundo faces is the threat posed by thieves and delinquency in the area. He seeks credit in order to purchase greater stock of chicken, eggs and weighing scales, in order to increase his profits.  Segundo hopes to begin raising chickens in the future as well.

loans.use: to buy chicken, eggs and scales

loans.name: Needs Ld-Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 42 year old widow without children. Her business is well-organized. Jacqueline sells shoes. She employs one person and her business is open from 8am until 7pm every day. Jacqueline has had one year's experience in this business.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With the profits, Jacqueline will expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Thomas Mwai

texts.en:
Thomas has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 47 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 12,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Thomas hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en casa de su familia, que se encuentra ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de La Victoria en Chiclayo. Esta familia no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe. 

La actividad principal de la comunidad, de Bertha, es la agricultura y la ganadería. El esposo de Bertha es peón realizando labores agrícolas. Por otro lado Bertha cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales menores (patos, pavos, gallinas, cuyes) y además realiza  faenas agrícolas, junto a su esposo. La crianza de animales le reporta buenos ingresos a Bertha, lo que le permite ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

Bertha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles que desea utilizar para el arreglo de su casa. Con este dinero y el dinero que su esposo ha ahorrado Bertha podrá comprar calaminas y otros materiales para mejorara los interiores de su hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha is 38 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in her family's home which is located in the rural area of La Victoria district, in Chiclayo.  This family does not have basic services of electricity, water and sewerage.

The main business activities in Bertha's community are farming and livestock raising.  Bertha's husband is an agricultural laborer.  Bertha has 10 years experience raising animals (ducks, turkeys, hens and guinea pigs).  She also carries out farm work together with her husband.  The livestock raising makes Bertha good profits which allow her to help her husband with their household expenses.

Bertha is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she would like to use to fix up her home.  With this money and some money that her husband has saved up, Bertha will be able to buy corrugated metal sheets and other materials to improve the inside of her home.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to fix up her home

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Thelma has a rice vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more rice for resale.

Thelma has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI III est un regroupement de l’Association  des femmes mariées du village de NIKANKAN de la sous préfecture de KIMPARANA   du cercle San, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de SORO Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
SITAN, première debout en T-shirt bleu blanc, utilisera son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de MORIBILA,SAN, et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 45 000 à 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: BENKADI III is a group in the married women’s association of the village of NIKANKAN, sub-prefecture of KIMPARANA, in the Cercle of San, Region of SÉGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families, and they average 38 years of age and six children each. The group members grow peanuts. Concerned about making their plantations profitable, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After properly repaying the previous loans, they are now on their fourth farm loan. SITAN, the first one standing in the photo and wearing a white and blue T-shirt, will use her loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and some soil amendments for farming. These items will be purchased at the main market of SAN. Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain in value, and then are sold for cash at the main markets of MORIBILA and SAN and at surrounding markets. The customers generally come from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 45,000 to 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan interest and to cover typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds, and tools

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Fue la cuñada D. Violeta quien le enseño a trabajar vendiendo productos D. belleza  al principio empezó como su ayudante y poco a poco fue incursionando por su propia cuenta ofreciendo a sus amigos y familiares así fue ganando sus propios clientes  en la actualidad el negocio es D. ella aparte D. vender cosméticos y colonias  también ofrece tintes D. cabello  gracias a su trabajo colabora con los gastos familiares sobretodo con la lonchera D. sus hijos y los alimentos diarios, ahora se iniciara en otro negocio que es recargas virtuales y venta D. tarjetas para celulares, su préstamo lo usara para la compra D. tarjetas este negocio tiene mucha acogida debido a la demanda D. este servicio, la Sra. Violeta es socia del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO” grupo formado por 10 socias que viven en puente piedra Lima Perú.

  * Violeta viste polo blanco sin mangas (parada)
texts.en:
Violeta's sister-in-law was the one who taught her how to sell beauty products.  At first she worked as an assistant, but little by little she became independent and offered her products to friends and family to establish her own customer base.  Now she also sells cosmetics, colognes and hair color products.  Through her work she is able to help out with household expenses, especially daily food costs for her children.  She is about to set up a new business which is the sale of cell phone cards and virtual recharge.  She will use the loan to buy cards for this business which is in much demand.  Mrs. Violeta is a member of the communal bank "MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO" which is comprised of 10 members that live in Puente Piedra in Lima, Perú.

* Violeta is standing and dressed in a white tank top.

loans.use: To buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Ezira

texts.en:
Ezira is aged 25 and single. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for three years now. His mixed farm produces milk and eggs, which are sold to the local market. He earns additional income from his battery-charging business in the same town.

Ezira has made a loan request of 31,200 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him expand his farming activities and improve his livelihood. He faces the challenge of insufficient animal feeds, which affects affects his production. He plans to acquire five quality dairy cows in the next five years that will improve his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles inició su negocio, cantidad que le ayudo para poder comprar las jabas de bebidas, además del contenido. 
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas  gaseosas heladas.  Son tres años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos.  Vive en la casa de su mamá, ella es quien le ayuda tanto a ver a su hijo y su pequeño negocio que tiene instalado en su misma casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 jabas de gaseosa en botella de vidrio personal, 3 paquetes de agua mineral, 2 paquetes de gaseosa guaraná, 1 paquete de pepsi cola, 2 paquetes de inca cola grande, 1 paquete de coca cola de 2.5 litros.
En estos días la venta ha bajado debido al clima, hace mucho frío y por ello vende poco.  Ha pensado, más adelante poner una pequeña bodega donde pueda vender otros productos.  Espera que Manuela Ramos la siga apoyando con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the "Líderes Triunfadoras" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 31 years old and a single mother with one dependent child.  She used her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles to start her business.  The money helped her to buy some drinks crates as well as their contents.

Mercedes' business is selling soda and she has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years.  She lives in her mom's home.  Her mom helps her a lot so that she can see to her son and her small business which is located in her home.

Mercedes will use this new loan for 1,700 soles to buy 5 crates of soda in individual bottles, 3 packets of mineral water, 2 packets of Guaraná soda, 1 packet of Pepsi, 2 packets of large bottles of Inca cola, 1 packet of 2.5 liter bottles of Coca Cola.

Recently, Mercedes' sales have dropped because of the weather.  It is very cold and so she does not sell very much.  She is planning to set up a small grocery store in the future where she can sell other products.  She hopes that Manuela Ramos will continue supporting her with their loans.

loans.use: to buy soda wholesale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells second-hand bags as a peddler in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has seven children. Her ex-husband assists her in taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy second-hand bags to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bags to sell.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is married to a young and beautiful lady named Misael. Their one child attends elementary school. Elmer is a farmer, and his wife is a former Overseas Filipino Worker.

Aside from planting and harvesting corn, Elmer has a hog raising business. He started this business while his wife was abroad. His wife came back to the Philippines and decided not to go back abroad, and she helps Elmer in managing their business.

Elmer wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his twelve pigs. He always hopes to succeed in his business and to grow as an entrepreneur and borrower.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his twelve pigs.

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en:
Jackilou is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Jackilou has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from FULLERLIFE. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks from FULLERLIFE to sell.

Jackilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothes & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing and dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from a general store business. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fabric for her dressmaking business. 

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Martha Gricely

texts.es:
Martha Gricely tiene 53 años, es soltera vive con  el hijo de veintidos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Martha Gricely se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl. Los productos los Compra y vende en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas, insecticidas para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir en el negocio y aumentar la producción.

En los momentos libres le gusta ver la televisión en especial las novelas.
texts.en:
Martha Gricely is 53 years old.  She is single and lives with her 22-year-old son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank is located in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Martha is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon pea.  She buys her products in Comercial Murillo and sells them in the same place.

Martha is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, manure and insecticides to keep her crops in good condition.

The support of this loan will help Martha to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue in her business and increase her production.

In her free time, Martha enjoys watching television, particularly soap operas.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, manure and insecticides

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es casada, 47 años D. edad, cursó los grados D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica al bordado D. blusas, inició este trabajo como trabajadora para un negocio D. su señora madre y hasta el momento lleva 20 años D. experiencia.

Organiza un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un prestamos que le servirá para la compra D. lustrina D. diferentes colores, ya que el el material principal para que ella pueda producir mas, en el futuro espera tener suficiente capital, incrementar sus ingresos y tener varios empleados. Las demás integrantes del grupos se dedican al bordado, la tejeduría y a la venta D. comida.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina is 47 years old and married. She attended primary school and has 3 children none of whom studies. She embroiders blouses. She started this work as an employee in her mother's business and up until now has 20 years of experience.

She organizes a group with the goal of asking for loans that will be used to purchase lustring (alpaca material) of different colours as it the main material so that she is able to produce more. In the future she hopes to have sufficient capital, increase her income and have several employees. The other members of the group work in embroidery, weaving and selling food.

loans.use: to buy lustring (shiny alpaca material)

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao is a 43-year-old married man who supports four people (his wife and three children). He has been a mixed farmer for the last eight years and he deals in both animal trade and wheat farming. The farming business has proved to be doing well in the area due to the conducive climatic conditions.

He learned about KADET from KADET staff during a marketing session done in his area of business. This will be his third loan and he is planning to buy more sheep and farm inputs which include seedlings and farming equipment. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to expand the business.

His hope and dream is to become a prominent business man in livestock and to buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs for the next planting season.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Маъруф трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Более 15 лет он занимается купля продажей сухофруктов. Он торгует на местных рынках города и получает хороший прибыль. От прибыли он купил дом для сына с женой, чтобы они жили отдельно и стали самостоятельными. Его сын и жена переехали в новый дом, и он сам с женой остался в старом доме. Маъруф хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки сухофруктов с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Maruf is a hardworking and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits for over 15 years.  He sells at local town markets and makes a good profit.  He used his profits to buy a house for his son and his son's wife, so that they could live separately and become independent.  Maruf's son and daughter-in-law moved to the new house, and Maruf and his wife stayed in the old house.  Maruf wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of dried fruits in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Monica Dalila

texts.es:
Mónica, vive con su familia, su esposo es agricultor, y la demás familia le apoya, ella administra una tienda y venta de pupusas,  este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende todos los días, la tienda desde muy temprano y la pupuseria por las tardes.
Actualmente quiere comprar mercadería para la tienda, aceite, huevos, queso, arroz, frijoles, condimentos, sopas, espaguetis, y demás productos que los clientes demandan.
Ella quiere solventar la situación de falta de mercadería, iniciando con este préstamo, espera que continúen mejor las ventas y que su condición cambie.
texts.en:
Mónica lives with her family.  Her husband is a farmer and the rest of her family support her.  She runs a store and sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  She started the business on her own initiative and works every day, opening the store early in the morning and the "pupuseria" in the afternoons.

Currently she wants to buy goods for the store such as oil, eggs, cheese, rice, beans, condiments, soups and spaghetti, as well as other items requested by the customers.

She hopes to resolve the problem of a lack of merchandise through this loan, hoping her situation will change and sales will increase in volume.

loans.use: To buy oil, eggs, cheese, rice, beans, condiments, soups and spaghetti.

loans.name: Yackeline

texts.es:
Yackeline de 25 años vive en la linda capital de Colombia, Bogotá, con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Desde hace 3 años ella inició un negocio con la ayuda de su cuñada en el cual confecciona y comercializan ropa especialmente en tela de jeans. 

En su negocio maneja un sistema donde ella diseña y corta pantalones para damas y los envía a una microempresa satélite, para que sean confeccionados y comercializados en eventos de comercialización como “el madrugón”, que tiene lugar los días miércoles y sábados. 

Su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa y lograr incorporar a su negocio todo el proceso de la confección. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materia prima como telas hilos e hilazas para la fabricación de jeans para la temporada de final de año, en el cual las ventas se incrementan y ella debe aprovechar para ganar un buen dinero. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 25 years old and lives in the beautiful capital of Colombia, Bogotá, with her spouse and small 1-year old son.  She started a business three years ago, with the help of her mother-in-law, making clothing from jeans fabric.

The system she uses in her business is that she designs and cuts jeans for women, then sends them to a satellite enterprise to be produced.  She offers them at various merchandising events such as at ““El Madrugón”, which takes place at dawn on Wednesdays and Saturdays.

Her biggest dreams are to have her own house and to manage to incorporate all levels of manufacturing into her business.  Currently, she is applying for her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads and yarns for making jeans for the holiday season.  

This is a time when demand and sales are higher, and she must take advantage of the opportunity to make good money.  This is the reason why she appeals for Kiva credit.

loans.use: buy more raw materials such as fabrics, threads and yarns for manufacturing jeans.

loans.name: Duo Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
DUO PAZ  Y AMOR
La Srita. Elsa Elizabeth es una joven trabajadora que se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y frutas en le mercado municipal, también sale a vender en días de mercado ella realiza esta actividad porque es el medio que la a ayudado a salir adelante y poder apoyar a sus padres en la economía de su familia, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace siete años tiene ya varios clientes  que la conocen como buena vendedora y en ocasiones le hacen pedidos de verduras por docenas, lamentablemente ella no cuenta con un capital grande para poder entregar estos pedios es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras. Olga Rosario, ella se dedica a la venta de refacción por la mañana sale a vender  en una escuela de la comunidad donde vive  y por la tarde vende en la plaza municipal vendiendo atol , chuchitos, tostadas y otros productos, ella necesita un capital para poder salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres que son de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Elsa Elizabeth is a young worker who buys and sells vegetables and fruits in the municipal market.  She also goes out to sell on market days.  She does this work because it has helped her get ahead and she can support her parents.  She has done this work for seven years and she has many customers who know her as a good seller.  Occasionally, they will order vegetables in bulk, and unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to fill those orders.  She is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables.  

Olga Rosario works selling snacks.  In the morning, she sells near a school in the community where she lives, and in the afternoon she sells in the town plaza.  She sells atol [corn based drink], chuchitos [type of tamale], tostadas [corn tortillas topped with salsa], and other products.  She needs the loan to get ahead and help her parents, who have few resources.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, es empleado del hospital nacional, vive con su familia, reside en una propiedad de una amiga quien le ha dado lugar de que vivan en su terreno, el es una persona muy trabajadora lleva 23 años como empleado del hospital y siendo puesto de bodega.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de una bomba para pozo de agua, ya que esto le ayudará a obtener el agua del pozo de una manera más fácil y mucho esfuerzo.
El quiere que este préstamo le ayude a solventar la necesidad, después de la instalación de la bomba puedan mejorar su con mis Joan y descansar un poco más de las tareas del hogar.
texts.en:
José is employed at a national hospital.  He lives with his family on the property of a friend who has given him some space to live on her plot of land.  He is a very hard-working person who has spent 23 years as an employee of the hospital and tending his position in the warehouse.

He needs the loan for the purchase of a pump for a well, as this will help him to get water from the well more easily and with less effort.

He wants this loan to help him meet his need, as the installation of the pump will help improve his life and relax a little more with his household tasks.

loans.use: to buy a pump for his well.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica sells rice porridge at Brasi near Abura. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children.  She has been selling porridge for 15 years.  She uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills. Veronica will use her loan to purchase bulk rice for the preparation of porridge. With the new profits, Veronica will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of bulk rice for making porridge.

loans.name: Sha'migul

texts.ru: Шаъмигул 44 года. Она Вдова. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Шаъмигул печет лепешки для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки и масла.
texts.en: Sha'migul is 44 years old and a widow.  She has three children.  She has a high school education.  Sha'migul bakes and sells flat breads and has been engaged in this occupation for 12 years.  She is taking out a loan to buy flour and oil.

loans.use: to purchase flour and oil.

loans.name: Banco Comunal La Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal La Esperanza está conformado por 12 integrantes en el cual ya han atenido crédito con Fundación León, este grupo son emprendedores que día a día lucha por sacar a su familia a delante, la presidenta de este grupo los motiva para que sigan adelante con sus negocios y generar ingresos a la familia. Santos Ramona es parte del grupo en el cual su actividad económica es la venta de ornada, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en la localidad donde ella habita. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima y poder incrementar el negocio.
texts.en: The 'La Esperanza' (Hope) community bank has 12 members who have already received a loan from Fundación León.  The members of this group are entrepreneurs who work hard every day to provide for their families.  The group's president encouraged them to make progress in their businesses and make income for their families.  Santos Ramona is a member of this group.  Her business activity is selling decorations.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in the local area.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy raw materials so that she can increase her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: El sr. Larry de 35 años  de edad, es soltero, habita en su casa de habitación con su compañera de vida, tiene dos hijos de relaciones anteriores que dependen de él, uno en secundaria y el otro en Preescolar, su compañera trabaja Conserje. El trabaja como conductor desde hace 15 años.Entre los dos sustentan los gastos del hogar, son personas trabajadoras y con deseos de superacion, ya que con cada credito han ido mejorando las condiciones de su casa, haciendole reparaciones o ampliaciones necesarias para la comodidad de su familia. Esta vez Solicita el refinanciamiento de su credito para destianarlos a mejoras de vivienda, para subirle el nivel de altura a su casa, y reparar un baño con el que actualmente no cuenta su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Larry, 35 years old, is not married, but lives with his partner.  He has two dependent children from a previous relationship, one in secondary school and the other in pre-school. His partner works for Conserje.

He has worked as a driver for the past 15 years. Between the two they pay for household expenses.  They are hardworking people and want to better themselves because with each loan they have been improving the conditions of their house, making repairs or necessary expansions to increase the family’s comfort

This time, Larry is requesting refinancing for his loan in order to improve his house by elevating it and by reconditioning a bathroom, which currently his house lacks.

loans.use: to recondition a bathroom.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: She is a 35 years old woman, Mrs. Victoria Okighogho, married with four (4) children living in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She learnt her trade business for 3 years before she started her business in the year 2001. She is eager to access the above amount to acquire more goods for sales.

loans.use: Sale of beauty materials

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a married mother of six children, three boys and three girls. She is 52 years old. She lives with her husband and children at the village of Gagaifo. Her business is planting taro, worked by her husband five days a week leaving Sunday for rest and to recoup. She sells 3-4 bags of taro each week and gets $250-$300. This is her fifth loan, which tells how interested she is in being a member of SPBD, because without the help from the program Elisapeta could not afford to look after and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase 1 box of cramoxone.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Loi was born in 1973 and her husband was born in 1960. They have a daughter and a son. Their daughter attends ninth grade. Their son doesn’t go to school yet. Loi sells vegetables at the local market. Her husband is a day laborer. Their income is $11 per person/month. If she gets a loan of $75, she can expand her business and save money for her daughter's school fees. They are going to repay monthly.

loans.use: Selling vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes business

loans.name: Ni

texts.id:
M. W. is a pig farmer in her house to help her husband who is a building laborer to support family expoenses and to pay for schooling of their 2 children. M. W. started her business by buying 2 pig breeders for Rp 1,500,000 (about $160), which she raised for six months, and was able to produce 14 offsprings, which she sold for Rp175,000 (about $18) per baby offspring. For that she profited Rp 950,000 (about $100), that she used to pay for her children's education, and a small portion she used to renovate her very modest home. M. W. plans to expand her business by taking care of 2 fattening pigs, so that with the extra capital she hope to receive from DINARI she would use to buy animal feed for the 2 breeder pigs and also the fattening pigs that she would raise, so that her meager income could also expand.

M. W. memelihara ternak babi di rumahnya untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya dan juga untuk menyekolahkan 2 orang anaknya. Ibu M. W. megawali usahanya dengan membeli 2 ekor bibit penginduk dengan harga Rp. 1.500.000,- yang kemudian dipeliharanya selama enam bulan dan berhasil memproduksi 14 ekor anak babi dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 175.000,- per ekor sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya Rp. 950.000,-. Dari keuntungan uasahanya ini M. W. membiayai pendidikan anak-anaknya dan sebagian kecil disisihkan untuk merenovasi rumahnya yang masih sederhana. M. W. berencana mengembangkan usahanya dengan memelihara 2 ekor penggemukan, sehingga tambahan modal dari Dinari dipakainya untuk membeli kebutuhan pakan bagi kedua penginduk dan juga penggemukan yang akan dipeliharanya sehingga pendapatan juga semakin bertambah.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy animal feed

Membeli makanan ternak

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila S. is married and has a teenage daughter. She is a private entrepreneur who works in the central city market of Melitopol selling men’s clothing. Her kiosk offers a large variety of men’s outer wear at reasonable prices. Ludmila has been in business for 10 years. Today she has about $5000 in inventory and her working capital exceeds $4000. Ludmila has benefited a lot from five years of partnering with Nadiya Ukraine. Lending services have helped her buy a new vending facility in a different part of the city, reach sustainability in her business, and have given her confidence for the future.

Ludmila needs a loan of $1200 to re-stock her inventory and purchase clothing wholesale for the fall/winter season. She believes that the sphere of market trade where she works is a promising niche and will continue to grow and develop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his shoe-selling business

loans.name: Sahati

texts.en: Sahati is a 51-year-old woman who sells snacks, coffee, candies, etc. at her small food stall. She earns upto US$9.5 per day. Her husband, S. has been unemployed for a long time, so she is now supporting her family's daily needs. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$125 to buy more goods for her food stall. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her food stall

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
The business of red meat sales is proving profitable to Hilda who, at 40 years of age, is the hard-working mother of three children. For the past 20 years she has dedicated herself to purchasing, feeding and caring for sheep until they reach the appropriate weight. She offers fresh meat from her butcher shop to her customers. This enterprise, which she carries out with the support of her family, is allowing her to help her children get ahead. Thanks to her great efforts, they will shortly complete their high school studies. Hilda’s wish is to increase her business capital, which is why she seeks a loan she can invest in her business for additional yields. We can all help her reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de venta de carnes rojas le está resultado rentable a la señora Hilda de 40 años de edad, ella es madre empeñosa de 3 hijos, desde hace 20 años está dedicada a comprar ovinos, luego de cuidarlos y alimentarlos diligentemente para que tomen un peso y tamaño adecuado procede a degollarlos y vender su fresca carne a sus clientes ya selectos.Este oficio que desempeña con apoyo de su familia le esta permitiendo impulsar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes gracias al esfuerzo de su madre dentro de muy poco tiempo concluirán sus estudios superiores.El deseo de Hilda es aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese fin hace la solicitud de un préstamo que luego de su inversión le permitirá obtener mayores beneficios. Vosotros podemos ayudar a conseguir la meta que se ha planteado.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase a greater quantity of small animals.

loans.name: Branka

texts.en: Branka is a 54 year old woman who lives  with her husband and her mother in town Bratunac. Her husband has 1000 KM monthly pension and they dont have children. Branka will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM for buying swines for good. She thinks that this investment will be good for their future income.

loans.use: Buying swines.

loans.name: Maimuna's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Maimuna is 46 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ranging in age from 14 to 25 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 18. Maimuna owns a small food vendor store and she also does embroidery of bedsheets, which she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $345 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma, who has a business dealing in shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her businesss

loans.name: Gladys Jassivi

texts.es:
Gladys started her business selling cosmetics three years ago when she needed to pay for her studies. Now she pays for her studies and sells her products to her classmates, family, and friends.

She requests a $250 loan that she will repay in three months. There is going to be a fair in her hometown and she would like to increase her inventory to be ready to sell more during the fair. With your help, Gladys will succeed in continuing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys inicio el negocio de venta de cosméticos hace 3 años, ya que se vio en la necesidad de colaborar con los gastos de sus estudios, ahora ella sola los costea y vende entre sus compañeros de escuela, familiares y amigos estos productos.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que pronto habrá una feria en el pueblo donde vive y desea incrementar su inventario para estar lista para esas fechas, y poder vender mas. Con tu ayuda Gladys lograra continuar con sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Buy

texts.en:
Buy K., aged 46, is a mother of seven and works as a farmer in Siem Reap province. She plants both rice and vegetables and makes $2.50 per day. Her husband has been a truck conductor since 1999. He can earn about $5 of profit per day. Two of their children are married and live away from home, one daughter is a teacher, another child works selling groceries, and the others help their parents in the rice fields.

Growing rice and vegetable by depending on the weather alone is a shaky and unreliable farming method these days, and they do not have enough water for their crops. To make the rice crop grow faster Buy and her husband are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and a water pump, with the rest of the money being used to buy groceries for her child to increase sales.

(Mrs. Buy is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, a water pump and grocery items.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet P., 24, is married. She has many years of experience working in the Elei printing business. She sells Elei, Samoan screen-printed material, to the villagers and the public 5 days per week.

Janet is requesting her first loan, which she plans to use to purchase more carved designs, paint, and raw materials for printing Elei material. She expects her weekly profit to be 300 Tala (about 125 USD). SPBD loans are Janet’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase carved designs, paint, and raw materials for Elei material

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi D., 49 years old, has been with TYM since the year 2000. Like many other in the group, at the beginning, she only borrow 2 million VND to invest in breeding cattle. After the first 2 years, even though she has achieved some success, the profit hasn't been very high, so after talking with her husband and children, she decide to send her son to learn mechanic. After he graduated from the school, she decided to take out another loan to open up a mechanic store in the village. This proved to be a big success and all of the profit in the few years after were put back to improve the facility and open up the shop. She had also been able to bought a truck to help with the transportation of materials, equipments as well as products. This cycle, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in this mechanic shop. Her family monthly income is about 7 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen , Kiva volunteer

Chị Dương Thị Định 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2000. Cũng giống như các chị em khác trong cụm vòng vốn ban đầu chị xin vay 2.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, qua 2 năm vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi mặt dù có cho thu nhập nhưng kết quả là không cao, nên chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng và các con chị cho con trai đi học nghề cơ khí. Sau khi con trai chị đã có nghề trong tay chị đã vay vốn và mở xương nhỏ làm cơ khí, công việc thuận lợi thu nhập từ xương cơ khí rất cao, các đồng vốn đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào mở rộng nhà xưởng sản xuất và gia đình chị cũng đã mua được 1 chiếc ô tô chuyên vận chuyển hàng của gia đình và chở thuê khi khách hàng có nhu cầu. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào xưởng cơ khí. Thu nhâp bình quân. 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Greetings from Nelson in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Nelson is 35 years old, married with seven children.

Nelson runs his own forex bureau in Gisenyi town because it's very close to the border of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo. He makes about US$ 77 per month from money exchanging.

He is looking for a loan worth 502 265 frws to increase his working capital.

loans.use: Increase his working capital

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Sr. Santiago P. es oriundo del barrio Virgen del Carmen de Carapeguà es constructor de obras se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven ,gracias a este trabajo puede mantener a su familia y pagar los estudios de sus hijos , tiene casa propia

De joven había atravesado por un enfermedad que con mucha perseverancia había logrado superar en ese tiempo conoció a la Señora María que hoy es su compañera en la vida ella lo ayuda llevando adelante un pequeño negocio que tiene en la casa

Con el crédito comprará una herramienta que le hace falta para realizar su trabajo .
texts.en:
Santiago P. is a native of the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood in Carapeguà. He is a construction worker who has been working in this field since he was very young. Thanks to this job he can support his family, pay for his children's studies and have his own home. As a young man he suffered through an illness that, thanks to his perseverance, has been able to overcome. During this period he met María who today is his wife and who helps him to carry forward a small business that they have in their house. With the loan he will buy a tool that he needs to perform his work. .

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for his construction work

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: Née le 02 Juin 1980 à Parakou dans le département du Borgou au Nord du BENIN, dame A. Blandine est de nationalité béninoise et est mariée à Monsieur DAVINON Paulin. Elle a à sa charge deux enfants: Marius et Bernice âgés respectivement de 7 ans et 4 ans. Coiffeuse de profession et diplômée depuis les années 1999 à Cotonou, elle a ouvert son atelier à son domicile et a sous sa responsabilité trois apprentis.Elle vient solliciter son deuxième crédit à ALIDé pour s'acheter un séchoir afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on June 2, 1980 in Parakou in Borgou Province in the north of Benin, Mrs. Blandine A. is a citizen of Benin and married to Mr. Paulin Davinon. She is raising two children, Marius and Bernice, aged 7 and 4 respectively.

A hairdresser by trade, she earned her diploma in 1999 in Cotonou. She opened a salon in her home and is responsible for three apprentices. She has requested this, her second loan from Alidé to buy a hairdryer so as to better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 dozen hair extensions and a hairdryer

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov C. is a villager in Ta Sean village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Seng Sokheang, repairs cassette players. He now has a lot of customers but does not have enough cassette player equipment to meet his customers' needs. Therefore, Mrs. Pov C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more equipment for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest is seven moths old.

loans.use: To buy cassette player equipment to repair customers' machines.

loans.name: Masuma

texts.ru: Масума женщина которой 42 года замужняя, имеющая одного ребенка. Масума торгует на рынке мужской одеждой.За товаром она ездиет в Истаравшан. У неё небольшой лорёк, она хочет получив займ закупить зимний ассортимент.Она уже хочет получить очередной второй займ. Первый кредит она закончила отлично.
texts.en:
Masuma is a 42 year old woman, married with one child. She sells men's clothing at a market. She travels to Istaravshan to buy the goods. She has a small vending space, and used a loan to buy winter inventory. She already wants to obtain a second loan. The first loan she completed successfully.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Menswear

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 53 years old and married with one child. Delia sells clothing on credit to friends, family members and neighbors. She also sells catalogue cosmetics.  Delia needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy t-shirts, shirts and sheets. Delia’s dreams are to get ahead in life and sell more products in each of her businesses. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Delia es socia del banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua. 
Delia es casada, tiene 53 años y 1 hijo, Delia venD. ropa que ofrece a amigos, familiares, vecinos, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Delia venD. cosméticos por catálogos. 
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. polos, camisas, sabanas. 
Los sueños D. Delia son salir adelante, aumentar con mas productos sus negocios.

loans.use: Buying t-shirts, shirts and shoes

loans.name: Shamsuddin

texts.en: Shamsuddin who is a young man lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has got a burger and ice cream shop where he works hard during all seasons, however in winter, he can not sell ice cream. Instead he sells some extra Afghani food then. He wants to expand his business and buy the essential things related to his business. He would like to receive an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to support his family in a better way and progress well.

loans.use: Buying more needed materials for his cafe

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: This is Nana K., a local entrepreneur in the city of Makeni. She is 40 years old, and has lived her whole life in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children. This is her second loan from SMT. With her first loan, she was able to expand her business. Nana has seen a vast improvement in her business as a result of the first loan. Having repaid it successfully, she is now requesting a new loan to further strengthen her business. Nana sells items like sprays, chains, jeans, lace, cottons, and shoes.

loans.use: Increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Liliana Tereza

texts.es: La señora es viuda y vive con su tres hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando, ella es la unica proveedora del hogar, desde muy temprano se dedica a preparar los alimentos para su venta. Los hijos menores en sus momentos libres colaboran a la madre en el mercado,La señora tiene el deseo de ver a sus hijos profesionales por lo que no escatima esfuerzo para mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir los requerimientos de sus hijos. El negocio esta ubicado en el popular mercado Yungas, solamente atiende desayunos, por lo tanto el resto del dia se los dedica a sus hijos en todas sus actividades.
texts.en:
She is a widow and lives with her three children who are currently studying. She is the only provider of the household. From the very early morning she dedicates her time in preparing foods for sale. The younger children, in their spare time, help their mother in the markets. She dreams of seeing her children as professionals, the reason why she doesn't spare any effort to improve her income and cover her children's needs. The business is located in the very popular market of Yungas, being there only for the breakfast hours. The rest of the day she dedicates herself to her children and all of their activities.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of coffee cups and drinking glasses

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Mrs. Conchita P. is 58 years old, married, and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Her husband is a driver. She owns a “sari-sari” (general) store and has been obtaining additional working capital from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since November 2006. Conchita has availed several other loans already. Today, she is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional goods to sell. Someday, she plans to expand her business into a mini grocery store, selling a variety of goods.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en:
Mahasen has owned a shoe store for five years. Mahasen is a 44-year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. She has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Mahasen has requested a loan.

Her clients can be anybody from her region. She has not faced difficulties since she first started her business. Mahasen chose this business because of financial need. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a shoe store

loans.name: Houédanou

texts.fr:
K. Houédanou est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Houédanou est mariée à KETE Elie, cuisinier de formation. Houédanou est mère de trois(3)enfants. Houédanou n’est jamais allée à l’école. Houédanou a été élevée par sa tante qu’elle aidait à vendre de produits congelés et de nourriture. Après son mariage, Houédanou s'est lancée dans la restauration populaire. Houédanou vend du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de maïs et de causette d’igname; le tout accompagné de différentes sauces telles que les sauces d’arachide, de tomate, de sésame, de noix de palme et de gombo. Houédanou a bénéficié déjà de deux prêts à ALIDé. Avec ces deux prêts Houédanou a pu élever le niveau de son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie. Houédanou sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour pouvoir faire ses provisions en gros au grand marché international du Bénin. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Houédanou K. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Houédanou is married to Elie Kete, a cook by profession. Houédanou is the mother of three children. Houédanou never went to school. Houédanou was raised by her aunt, whom she helped sell frozen products and food. After getting married, Houédanou began a catering business. Houédanou sells rice, beans, maize paste, and yam chips; all of these are accompanied by different sauces, such as those made from peanuts, tomatoes, sesame, palm nuts, and okra. Houédanou has already benefited from two loans through Alidé. With these two loans, Houédanou was able to raise the level of her business and improve her living conditions. Houédanou is seeking a third loan through Alidé to be able to buy her supplies in bulk at the grand international market of Benin. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg bags of maize and two 50-kg bags of rice

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo V. y su esposa Mirna Ivonne Alcaraz tiene cuatro hijos que actual mente están estudiando, pero tiene una problema en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar los exámenes y el pago de la mensualidad.
Don Gerardo V. tiene dos ingresos uno es como empleado en una compañía de trasportes, su segundo ingreso es de arbito los fines de semana, estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia. 
Cuando se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Gerardo el se encontraba en su trabajo, quien nos atendió fue la señora Mirna Ivonne, quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo V. and his wife, Mirna Ivonne Alcaraz, have four children who are currently studying, but at the moment they have the problem of not having enough money to pay for the exams or the monthly tuition payments.

Mr. Gerardo V. has two forms of income. One is as an employee of a transport company, the second is as a referee on the weekends. These are the forms of income that he has for his family.

When we made our visit to the residence of Mr. Gerardo he was at work and we were attended to by Mrs. Mirna Ivonne who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Scholastic support

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: khary K. est parent beneficiaire et habite la localite de cambereneelle ademare son activite de vente de chaussures depuis 1968.elle sollicite ce pret de 100 000frs pour augmenter son fonds et aaccroitre ses ravenus afin de mieux participer au soutient de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khary K. is mother and lives in the small town of Cambereneelle Ademare. Since 1968, her business has been consisting in selling shoes. She's seeking this loan of XOF 100'000 to bolster her working capital and increase her income, in order to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene O. is from Kinuman Village, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling bananas in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is thirty-five years old and a widow with eight children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Hawa is a trader. She deals in clothing materials. She sells at the market square and also hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. Hawa has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy more textiles to increase her stock. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To increase her stock of textiles

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the semtema A In Kihesa,Iringa,she is 37 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children,Her children are aged 23,20,17, and 11 years.

Lidia started her own shop business selling rice,sugar,salts 15 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 140,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Lidia`s second loan from BRAC Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Lidia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel F. O. es un hombre casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. El es un buen cliente de Fundación León 2000, los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para él. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente él se dedica a trabajar como mecánico, pero al quedar sin trabajo decide establecer una pequeña pulpería ofreciendo productos como jabón, aceite y golosinas. Sus propósitos son de seguir luchando por su negocio ya que hay muchos negocios como estos pero son pocos los que pueden permanecer tanto tiempo en este ámbito. Su deseo es proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos suficientes para comer cada día.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ganiyat

texts.en: For the last five years, Ganiyat has made a living selling food items and drinks. She is married, has two children and is 30 years old. Ganiyat and her family live in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and exends her thanks to Kiva lenders for their participation and support.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Yolanda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda sells "ukay-ukay" or second hand clothing in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila S. is married to Rodrigo and they have seven children. They live peacefully in the village of Quezon, San Isidro. Hog-raising is the main source of income for Nila. She is thankful for the benefits that she gets from her hog-raising business, and she would like to maintain her business in order to improve her family's standard of living. She is praying that the business would be profitable.

Nila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for the maintenance of her business. She will be grateful if her requested loan is granted. This loan will help her to supply her family's needs.

loans.use: As additional capital for the maintenance of her hog-raising business

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly T. is from the town of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 54 years old and a widow with one school-aged child. To make a living, Everly owns and operates a business selling personal home products, ready-to-wear items and drinks to local community members.

In 2009, Everly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Everly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to sustain her business. Everly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Urora

texts.es:
La señora   MARIA URORA M. M. , tiene  42 años, vive en el distrito de  MOCHE provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijas todas pequeñas y  dependen económicamente de ella .La socia se dedica a la crianza de patos, pollos y chanchos y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro patos bebes para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Con este crédito de 400.00 nuevos soles comprará pollos bebes doble pechuga para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos vivos o por kilos en el mercado cercano a su casa.
Ella sueña con tener su granja de pollos para así generar mayores ganancias y poder brindarles una mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus menores hijas.
texts.en:
María Urora M. Martínez is 42. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She attened school until her fifth year of high school. She has three small daughters who are economically dependent upon her. She raises ducks, chickens and pigs. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy baby ducks to raise and later sell. With this loan for 400 PEN she will by double breasted baby chickens. She will raise them and sell them live or by kilos in the market close to her house. She dreams of having a chicken farm in order to generate greater earnings. That way she will be able to give her daughters a better education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy double breasted baby chickens

loans.name: Rotchelyn

texts.en: Rotchelyn E. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Rotchelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rotchelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a fifty-four-year-old married mother of eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Ama is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell and also sells by the roadside in her community. She procures her ingredients from nearby communities.

Ama has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Las Sirenitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Sirenitas” esta representado por la señora  Mariana y conformado por 15 miembros,  es un grupo que  ha empezado en su 1er  ciclo, la mayoría son de la misma zona y se conocen bastante bien de manera que es un grupo muy unido y solidario por que entre todas se ayudan para que el grupo marche bastante bien, los integrantes  son 13 mujeres y 2 varones. Entre las actividades que realizan todas las socias podemos mencionar la atencion de juegos electrónicos, venta de joyas, huevos, ropa  y al servicio de transporte publico de carga y pasajeros, moto taxista, manicurista y la atención en salones de belleza. La competencia entre las socias esta realmente muy difícil, especialmente en la venta de joyas, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y experiencia salen adelante en sus negocios ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias El destino del crédito es poder hacer crecer sus negocios con la adquisición de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a  generar una mejor ganancia para el mantenimiento de sus hogares y para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayoría de las socias son personas, nuevas que ya conocen el producto por lo que se encuentran entusiasmados por el apoyo económico ya que muchos de ellos tienen grandes proyectos que desean realizar a futuro y saben que si cumplen con sus pagos en forma responsable contaran con el apoyo de la fundación siempre que lo requieran.
texts.en:
The “Las Sirenitas” cooperative bank is represented by Ms. Mariana, and comprised of 15 members. This is a group in their 1st loan cycle. A majority of members are from the same area and know each other well, making this a very united group where everyone helps each other out so they can succeed. The members are made up of 13 women and 2 men. Among the activities carried out by the group, we can mention electronic toy repairs, jewelry and clothing sales, public transportation services, manicurists, and beauty salon services. Competition among members is difficult, particularly in jewelry sales, but thanks to their efforts and experience they manage to get ahead with their businesses since their families depend on the income for support. The loan will be destined to help them grow their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them generate more income to maintain their homes and improve the standard of living for their families. The majority of the group’s members are new, who know their product, and are enthusiastic about having access to credit since many of them have dreams for grand future projects. They know that if they are responsible with their loan payments, they will be able to count on the foundation’s support when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is forty years old. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. She runs a grocery shop to support her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for twelve years now. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, tin fish, etc. Lucy procures her goods from wholesalers in the big city.  She seeks a loan to purchase groceries in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her kid’s education.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the village of Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 73 years-old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her pension and selling of daily use goods in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 10,350 PHP a month.

In 2008, Helen joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.
