Helen is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional housing materials. This loan will be the 21th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Violeta Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Violeta, ofrece los productos variados como calzados, ropa interior, cosméticos y venderlos en su pulpería, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas deseaba diversificar y no vender solamente un producto, con el objetivo de aprovechar la afluencia de los clientes a su negocio. La señora nos cuenta, que necesita este financiamiento para mantener la afluencia de sus clientes. Su sueño siempre es tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado que brinde estabilidad económica a ella, su mama y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Sra. Violeta offers a variety of products such as footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, and sells them from her shop. She hopes to increase her sales of these products and, most of all, diversify her inventory and not sell just one product. With this objective in mind, she wants to take advantage of the influx of customers to her business.

Violeta says she needs a loan to maintain the growth of her customer base. Her dream has always been to have a large store in the market that will provide financial stability for her, her mother, and her family in general.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
LOS GIRASOLES
La Alcancia Comunal LOS GIRASOLES  cursa el ciclo 17, esta conformado por 11 socias responsables, puntuales y preocupadas por el bienestar D. sus familias.
Como es el caso D. Dilma ella empezo un negocio en el Mercado D. San Luis el cual quedaba distante D. su casa, pero deseaba estar cerca a sus hijos asi que con la ayuda D. una amiga emprendio el negocio D. venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo este negocio le permitio disponer D. tiempo y estar cerca a sus hijos que para ella era primordial. Con el prestamo obtenido comprara productos en oferta para exibirlos venderlos y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
Hace muchos años Gina estudio cosmetologia oficio que ahora lo pone en practica ya que con la ayuda D. un prestamo pudo aperturar un Centro D. Estetica. Este negocio ayudo mucho a Gina ya que pueD. pagar la educacion y manutencion D. sus 3 hijos 
Luz es casada tiene 7 hijos y al igual que Dilma se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo y D. puerta en puerta en diversos lugares.  Ella y su esposo trabajan para los gastos en casa y tienen un objetivo que es la educacion y bienestar D. su familia.  LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL  LOS GIRASOLES ES LEAL A EDAPROSPO Y VIENEN DESD. EL AAHH  HORACIO ZEVALLOS GAMEZ HASTA LA OFICINA DEL PROGRAMA PROSPERIDAD D. EDAPROSPO UBICADA EN HUAYCAN.
texts.en:
LOS GIRALSOLES (the Sunflowers) The communal bank LOS GIRASOLES is in its 17th cycle and is maD. up of 11 members who are responsible, punctual and concerned for the wellbeing of their families. Such is the case with Dilma. She began a business in the San Luis market which is located far from her house. She wished she could be closer to her children so with the help of a friend she learned how to sell cosmetics via catalogue. This business allows her more time to be near her children which for her is crucial. With the loan she will buy sale items in order to display them and sell them and in this way obtain greater earnings. Gina has been studying the cosmetology traD. for many years and now she is putting it into practice. With the help of a loan, she was able to start an Esthetics Center. This business has help Gina greatly as now she can support her 3 children and pay for their education. Luz is married with 7 children and like Dilma sells cosmetics via catalogue and from door to door in various areas. She and her husband work to meet the household expenses and have their family’s education and wellbeing as their goal. THE COMMUNAL BANK LOS GIRASOLES IS A LOYAL SUPPORTER OF EDAPROSPO AND COMES FROM THE AAHH HORACIO ZEVALLOS GAMEZ TO THE OFFICE OF THE PROSPERITY PROGRAM OF EDAPROPO LOCATED IN HUAYCAN.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, food and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Auxiliadora López es una señora de 61 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2  hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Auxiliadora se desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería (tiendita de abarrotes) para vender productos básicos a sus vecinos en su propia casa; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢605.000(seiscientos cinco mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para ampliar su local y así poderle brindar una mejor atención  a sus clientes. Ella comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que tienen muchos clientes y por eso necesita más espacio.

Doña Auxiliadora es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Y hacer de su negocio una gran microempresa.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora López, 61, lives with her husband and two children in a community called Santa Fe in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is known for being a mountainous zone and for being very near the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are cattle raising and agriculture, specifically basic grains, sugar cane and oranges. Auxiliadora set up a small grocery store several years ago in her home. This activity has made it possible for her to have a profitable commercial activity that helps her improve her quality of life. She currently needs a 605.000 colones loan to buy building materials and supplies to enlarge her store so that she can offer better customer service. She comments that the service she provides is very important and she has many regular customers so she needs more space. Auxiliadora is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe (Santa Fe Spring communal bank), one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to improve her personal and economic status with it as well as to make her business into a micro business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has run his retail shop in Naivasha town for six years. He sells dry food stuff including rice, sugar, flour, and cereals, which he buys in bulk and re-sells to his customers in small quantities. He is 59 years old, married to Alice Njeri, and they have four children all in their thirties.

Moses was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan with which he plans to buy rice, wheat, flour and sugar in bulk. In the future, he plans to turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop and supply food items in bulk to local retailers.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat, flour, sugar to resell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro C. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 57 years old. Pedro is separated from his spouse and has five adult children. To make a living, Pedro owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Pedro has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pedro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. Pedro is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pedro from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo William de 54 años, su hija Mireya que es casada y tiene una hija, Sarai de 8 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la producción de estructuras metálicas, es por ello que su familia trabaja con ella en un taller que en conjunto lograron instalar en el patio de su propia casa, lo cual le ha resultado un negocio rentable. Nancy es la encargada de la administración del negocio mientras que su esposo y su yerno se dedican íntegramente al trabajo de la fabricación de puertas ventanas y todo lo que tenga que ver con metal, logrando darle el mejor acabado ya que eso es lo que le gusta y llama la atención de la gente. Siendo este un negocio de familia, todos se han propuesto comprar nueva maquinaría y así mejorar su producción. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP siendo siempre muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará metal para elaborar de acuerdo a los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Nancy, 49, is a hard-working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband, William, 54, and her daughter Mireya who’s married and has an 8-year-old daughter, Sarai. Her business is making things out of metal; her family works with her in a workshop they installed in their own yard. This has turned into a profitable business. Nancy runs the administrative part while her husband and son-in-law actually make the doors, windows and anything else having to do with metal managing to give the best finishings to the items which is what people like and attracts their attention. Since this is a family business, they have proposed buying new machinery to improve production. This is their 9th loan with MFP; they have always been very punctual with repayments. This requested loan will be used to buy metal to manufacture the items they have on pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo es un padre de familia de 63 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito agrícola de relieve muy accidentado, dada su cercanía a la sierra. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace masde diez años, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, de sus cosechas y la venta de las mismas depende el sostenimiento económico de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener sus cultivos de la mejor manera.

En esta ocasión el ha sembrado maíz y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para lograr que su cultivo brinde una buena cosecha, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Erasmo es un hombre bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus familiares y vecinos le consideran una persona responsable y bastante trabajadora.
texts.en:
Erasmo is a 63 year old dad that lives with his wife and two children in Nueva Arica, an agricultural district with rugged land, close to the mountains. It's located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agricultural activities for more than 10 years, he has a piece of land where he grows different kinds of grain, his family is dependent on the harvest and the sale of it, that's why he always does his best to keep the land in good shape. This time around he has sown corn and he is working really hard on it so he can have a good harvest, that's why he needs to request a loan of 1000 new soles that he plans to use in purchasing fertilizer for his crops. Erasmo is a family man. His wish is to give them a better quality of life. In the community, his family and neighbors consider him a responsible and hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for corn field.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila R. is from the village of Brgy. Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $105 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Prescila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Celiz Alexandra

texts.es: Celiz Alexandra tiene 39 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, ella ofrece productos como golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan, galletas y granos básicos. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Pues por su Mama fue que ella decidió tomar la administración de este medio de vida, en donde asisten muy clientes que siempre llegan a buscar diferentes productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, pues algunas personas siempre llegan a buscar nuevos productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Celiz Alexandra, age 39, has had a mini market for eight years. She sells products like sweets, soft drinks, juice, bread, crackers, and basic grains. Her business is located in her house. It was because of her mother that she decided to establish this way of earning a living. Lots of customers always go to her store to look for different products. She works everyday from seven in the morning until ten at night. Some people always come looking for new products. The loan is to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, crackers, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kabowa Mixed Farmers Group - Jinja

texts.en:
Bashiri B. has been in a commercial motorcycle business for six years. He has relied on profits from this business to shoulder most of his family’s responsibilities. On the basis of that, he has no regrets on why he began this business. As of now, he is only looking at ways of getting or buying more motorcycles, which he envisions will bring him more profits. 

With this loan, Bashiri, who is a single father of six, is optimistic his dreams will come to pass. With more motorcycles, he says he will be able to add onto the 100,000 shillings he makes in a week with just one bike. He says that before this business, he was a security guard and it is because of his hard work and determination that he is where he is right now.

loans.use: The purchase of an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: cette femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure.pour accroître ses revenus quotidiens, elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits cosmétiques. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. elle veut gonfler son stock pour accroître ses recettes, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 4 cartons de mèches,3 cartons de tissage et divers autres produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This woman is married and mother of two children. She is a trained hair dresser and to increase her revenue she also sells cosmetic products. She has been in this business since 2003 and she buys her products at the big open market in Lomé. She would like to improve her stock of articles in order to increase the profits and for this reason she requests a loan to purchase four boxes of hair extensions, three boxes of wigs and other different beauty products.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Nuru

texts.ru:
Nuru I. 50 let. On imeyet 3 detey, dochka 21 qod uchitsya v universitete, dochka 18 let v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 16 let uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom. Nuru yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,on pereselenec iz Kalbadjar, seychas projivayet v Absheron region.

Nuru uje 15 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse peremesheniye passajirov.
Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dedushki kotoriy toje bil voditelem avtobusa. Seychas Nuru nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya toqo chto pochinit mashinu.
texts.en:
Nuru I. is fifty years old. He has three children. His 21-year-old daughter studies at the university. His eighteen-year-old daughter is entering the university this year, and his sixteen-year-old son goes to school and plays sports. Nuru is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is a refugee from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region. For the last fifteen years, Nuru has been working transporting passengers. He started this business with his grandfather who was also a bus driver. Now, Nuru needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia  Verzosa is a married woman who lives in Sito Canonoy, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband, Bernie Verzosa, who is 43 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 12 and  20 years old.

Alicia  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alicia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future household expenses and savings. Alicia  Verzosa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Julio Ramon

texts.es:
Julio de 20 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). Tiene un puesto de fotocopia y venta de cuadernos. 

Cuando el era pequeño la mama tenia una papelería poco a poco el fue criado en un mundo de ventas y papeles, hasta que decidió tener su propio negocio comprando una fotocopiado y unos cuantos cuadernos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo clientela, en la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Cada cuadernos lo vende a $ 1.20, las copias a $ 0.10 según el color. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una copiadora y papelería para mejorar el servicio de su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería para asegurar su ahorros.
texts.en:
Julio is 20 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). He owns a stall where he makes photocopies and sells notebooks. 

When he was young his mother ran a stationery’s shop, and he was brought up little by little in a world of sales and paper, until he decided running his own shop by buying a copy machine and a few notebooks. He earned some customers little by little and with effort: he currently works form 7.30 am to 22 pm every day. He sells every notebook for $ 1.20 and he charges $0.10 a copy or more according to them being black and white or color.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a copy machine and stationery to improve the service offered in his shop. In the future he wants to run a stationery’s shop to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy a copy machine and stationery.

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor José del Carmen V. es trabajador de la alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como barrendero del tren de aseo es padre de 3 niños que están en edad escolar por los cuales se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo ya que con este salario vive toda su familia este financiamiento lo solicito para reparar parte del techo de su casa.
texts.en: Mr. José del Carmen V. is a worker in the municipality of Chinandega. He acts as a garbage truck sweeper. He is the father of 3 school-age children for whom he works hard since his whole family is supported by his salary. He is asking for this loan in order to repair part of the roof of his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Hedda

texts.en:
Hedda L. is a widow who lives in Purok Pag-asa, Poblacion II, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a general store, selling frozen foods and a RTW dealer (Natasha, Avon) businesses. She has 5 children and all have families of their own. 

Hedda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hedda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future. Hedda L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma B., 47, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Nicomedes B., 51, an overseas Filipino worker. Wilma is the mother of two children who are currently studying in high school and college. By the grace of God, Wilma has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send both of them all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents, like Wilma, is seeing their children receive a college diploma. Education is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Wilma maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer’s order is bought, in cash, by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are relying on as their income. Wilma’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Wilma dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also wants to have her own commercial stall for her direct selling business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her direct selling business

loans.name: Dufatanye Bategarugori Group

texts.fr: Rachel Nyiragasiqwa est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du groupe Dutanfane Bategarugori.  Elle a 39 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 6 enfants entre 1 an et 6 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 7eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kgs de pommes de terres, 50kgs de mais, et autres pour son activité d’agriculture.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer son activité en utilisant bien ce prêt en vue d’augmenter sa capacité.  Elle voudrait devenir une agricultrice en grande capacité dans son district de Rubavu.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait leur bien-être, lutte contre la pauvreté, et l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Rachel Nyiragasiqwa is a farmer and a member of the Dutanfane Bategarugori group. She is a 39 year old married mother with 6 children between 1 and 6, three of whom attend school. She left school after year 7 of primary school.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase 100 kg of potatoes, 50kg of corn and other supplies for her farming.  Her growth strategy for the business is to boost her output by using this loan. She would like to increase the scale of her business in the Rubavu district. Her aim is to help to see to her family's needs, including her children's education, and to fight against poverty.

loans.use: To purchase 100kg of potatoes

loans.name: Crispina

texts.es: Crispina tiene 56 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Vende muebles de metal (camas, literas y repisas) desde hace más de 30 años, junto con su esposo comenzaron con este trabajo, hoy es su fuente principal de ingresos, permitiéndole así tener ganancias semanalmente. Durante los días de semana fabrica los muebles, para luego venderlos sólo los domingos en la feria comercial de su localidad. La calidad y el buen acabado que tiene sus muebles le han dado mucha ventaja frente a los competidores, así asegura una buena venta. Es por esta razón que esta siempre al tanto de innovar con variados y nuevos diseños. Afirma que le agrada realizar esta actividad porque tiene amplia experiencia en este rubro y su deseo para el futuro es mejorar su taller. Es su crédito numero 4 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de muebles como fierros y electrodos.
texts.en:
Crispina, age 56, lives with her daughter in her own house.  She has been selling metal furniture (beds, bunk beds, and shelves) for over 30 years.  She and her husband started this work, and now it is her main source of income.  It allows her to have weekly earnings.

During the days of the week she makes the furniture.  She later sells it only on Sundays at the commercial fair in her area.  Because her furniture is of good quality and has a good finish, she has a big advantage over the competitors.  That is how she is assured of a good sale.  That is why she is always up to date with a variety of innovations and new designs.  She states that she likes this activity because she has a lot of experience in this field.  In the future she wishes to improve her shop.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a member of her communal bank because all of the members are people she knows; they are responsible and very supportive.  

She thanks those people who will be lenders of the loan she is requesting.  The loan will be very useful to the progress of her business activity.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy materials like iron and electrodes to make furniture.

loans.use: To buy iron and electrodes

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel M. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Ruel owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $234 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. 

Ruel is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be his 5th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María Santos, tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos, ellos estudian.
María se dedica a la venta de alimentos como pupusas, yuca, papitas fritas, desde hace tres años, ubicándose en el centro escolar donde vende de 7:00am a 5:00pm, también los domingos sale a vender a la cancha de futbol, este negocio le provee lo necesario para dar a sus hijos la alimentación que necesitan.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en una nueva actividad económica como lo es la crianza de cerdos ya que de esta actividad se obtienen ingresos al momento de vender los cerdos, también quiere comprar mercadería de la que utiliza para preparar las ventas. Este préstamo le ayudara a atender un nuevo negocio y a mantener al mismo tiempo sus ventas.
El objetivo de María es seguir trabajando cada día por sus hijos, para que no les falte lo necesario y puedan estudiar y superarse.
texts.en:
María Santos is 37 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department.  She is a single mother and lives with her three children who are studying.  María has been selling food such as pupusas, cassava and French fries for three years.   She sells her products from 7.00am to 5.00pm in a local school.  She also goes out to sell her products at a soccer field on Sundays.  This business allows her to put food on the table for her children.

María is currently requesting a loan to invest in a new business activity: raising pigs, as the income from this business comes at the moment the pigs are sold.  She would also like to buy the supplies that she needs to prepare her food.  This loan will help her to set up her new business and, at the same time, keep her current business running.

María's goal is to continue working every day for her children, so that their basic needs are covered and so that they can study and improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy pigs and merchandise

loans.name: 77-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hoa P. Thị (103) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Hoa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 77-Quảng Hưng (18-4-77).

Hoa is widowed and has no children.  To making a living, Hoa provides room rental services to local community members.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoa is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for 4248000 VND to purchase materials needed to expand her services.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by this borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Thuyết (105) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her general store business.


2.  N. Thị Nương (104) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her general store business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa P. Thị (103) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 77-Quảng Hưng (18-4-77 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 4500000 VND.  Vào 2011, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Thuyết (105) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  N. Thị Nương (104) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand service

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Хайдаров Ибодулло проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ибодулло занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Ibodullo H. lives in J. Rumy.  He is 33 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife.  Ibodullo works in sales.  He has a grocery shop. He has been doing this for more than six years.  He is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel S. de 51 años y es un emprendedor muy creativo, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposa y su hijo de 11 años de edad; allí se dedica a la preparación y venta de arroz de pollo desde hace seis meses, negocio que inició cuando quedó sin empleo y de él afloró su espíritu empresarial, al que fue agregando,  el servicio de alquiler de triciclos por tarifas a vendedores que tienen puestos de venta, como actualmente lo hace. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el  comprará un triciclo y materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, porque con ello  aspira  a obtener una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 9% y fortalecer su poco capital de trabajo, el cual es indispensable para seguir creciendo con mayor rapidez y para lograr el sueño de tener algún día su casa propia y conseguir que su hijo se eduque en la universidad.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel S., 51, is a very creative entrepreneur living in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and 11-year-old son.  For the last six months he has been working making chicken with rice to sell.  He started this business when he lost his job and his entrepreneurial spirit flowered.  He started to add to it.  He now rents tricycles out to vendors who have stands.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy a tricycle and raw materials and ingredients in large volume because this way he hopes to get a 9% profit on sales and strengthen his working capital a bit which is indispensible for continued, quicker growth and to reach his goal of one day owning a house and being able to send his son to university.

loans.use: to buy a trycicle and raw materials and ingredients in large amounts.

loans.name: Willam Ricardo

texts.en:
Willam is 28 years old and single. He lives in a house with his parents in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His community was formed about 17 years ago. It is a small community and does not yet have paved roads. It does, however, have access to electricity and potable water. 

For over a year, Willam has earned a living as an employee in a company that makes plastic containers used to hold plants in plant nurseries. He is responsible for operating the machine that produces the containers. This job allows for him to pay for his personal and household expenses. At the moment, Willam’s house is in a state of deterioration. He would like to make some repairs to it, which will help him to improve his family's quality of life. For this reason, he decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles. Willam is a hard-working man and he has a good personal and work-related reputation in the community.

loans.use: To make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 36 years old, married, and has two adopted orphans. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for one year. He transports people every day from 5 am until 12 pm. Jean Pierre would like to use this loan to buy a new motorbike. With his profit, he will build his own house for his family and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 26 years old and she has 2 children who are between 4 and 7 years old. Her husband is a driver. 

Aline is very hard working.  She sells tomatoes at wholesale and she has been selling tomatoes for 14 years. She has achieved several things; among these, she has been able to renovate her house. Aline is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Vecinos Victoriosos Group

texts.es: La señora Victoria C. Faustina vive en la Flor Distrito de Carabayllo tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 04 hijos empezo con el negocio ayudando al inicio a su madre quien vendia frente a su casa en un complejo deportivo luego con el pasar de los años ya su mami no podia salir a vender asi que la señora Victoria empezo a vender ella sola. Entre los productos que vende estan la rica papa rellena, cachanguitas, canchita, etc., Con su prestamo va a invertir en comprar mas insumos. Su sueño es poder tener una gran bodega.
texts.en: Mrs. Victoria C. Faustina, 48, lives in La Flor, Carabayllo District.  She’s married and has four children.  She started the business helping her mother who sold at a sports complex across the street from her house .  With the passage of time, her mother was unable to continue selling so Victoria started to do so by herself.  Among the products she sells are stuffed potatoes, “cachanguitas” (fried dough sprinkled with sugar), “canchita” (Peruvian popcorn), etc.  She will use her loan to buy more ingredients.  Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the sale of savory dishes.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from the village of Unidos, Plaridel. She is 64 years old. Fely is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice to sell. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Fely is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase sacks of fertilizers. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Everline is 33 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She is married and her husband is a Mason. They have four children, two of whom are attending school.

For the past two years, Everline has been selling pigs feet in the local market. She enjoys selling a lot since pigs feet is widely eaten in her community. One thing she loves the most is that she gets more income to enable her to pay for her children's tuition.

Everline is requesting a loan to purchase one barrel of pigs feet and a drum of oil. She plans to build a house and buy a car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one barrel of pigs feet and a drum of oil

loans.name: Tania Judith

texts.es: La Srta. Tania es soltera, tiene 19 de edad,  Tania  estudia Textileria y comercio ella escogió esta carrera ya que su familia tiene un negocio de confección de ropa en un taller  es así que Tania gracias a lo aprendido de su carrera trabaja en el negocio de su familia y aporta ideas modernas y también cose y crea modernos diseños de ropa, ella eligió esta profesión porque  es su vocación y considera que es una chica creativa y moderna , Su sueño de Tania  es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por ella, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que Tania  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Miss Tania is single and 19 years old. Tania studies textiles and commerce. She chose this career because her family has a clothing-making business in a workshop. Thanks to what Tania has learned, she works in her family's business and brings in modern ideas. She also sews and creates modern clothing designs. She chose this trade because it is her calling and she considers herself to be a creative and modern person. Her dream is to offer her parents a better quality of life, and to somehow return to them everything that they have done for her. With the goal of continuing to grow, she has requested a new loan to pay for her tuition and internships. We know that Tania will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work, and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and internships.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine es socia del banco comunal La Lupuna del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña (menor en edad) en edad escolar.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su casa, cuenta con una refrigeradora que es de gran ayuda, no es mucho lo que vende.  Está aprovechando que está libre, por el momento se está dedicando a este negocio, no gana mucho pero está haciendo el intento.  Debido a su condición de madre sola tiene que ver de qué manera solventa los gastos de su niña.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 jabas de gaseosa personal, 2 paquetes de gaseosa descartable, 1 paquete de agua mineral sin gas, 2 paquetes de gaseosa grande.
El próximo ciclo espera poder pedir un préstamo más alto para poder invertir en más mercadería.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por todas las oportunidades que da a las mujeres de esta parte del país.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a member of the communal bank "La Lupuna". It is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and she is the single mother of one girl (a minor) who is school aged.

She sells drinks from her home. She has a refrigerator and it is very helpful. She doesn't sell very much. She is profiting from her free time. At the moment she is managing this business and although she doesn't earn very much she's giving it a try. Given that she is a single mother she needs to find a way to provide for her daughter's expenses.

With her new loan, amounting to S/.1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase: 2 crates of soft drinks, 2 packages of drinking boxes, 1 package of mineral water, and 2 packages of large soft drink bottles. At the next loan cycle she hopes to be able to request a larger loan to invest in more merchandise. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for all of the opportunities given to women in this part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Don Efrain de profesion primer oficial labora al estado como funcionario publico, tiene mas de veintitres años laborando para el bien de las comunidades, en donde a traves de estudios, ha venido logrando mejores condiciones. 

Es casado su esposa trabaja en una tienda de pollo tiptop, sus dos pequeños hijos cursan la primaria.

Como objetivo don Efrain ha sido la construccion de su casa, en donde lo ha logrado con financiamiento en Afodenic con doce ciclos de prestamo, con el credito anterior logro hacer un bajarte en la parte de atrás, ya que es donde se lava la ropa y asi tener mejore condiciones.

Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para cambiar techo del lado de los cuartos en donde ira por parte, por que los materiales estan muy caros, y tiene  que medir su capacidad de pagos.
texts.en:
Efrain by profession works with the State in public services.  For over 23 years he has been working for the good of the communities.  During that time, through studies, he has been managing to improve conditions.

He is married, and his wife works at a TipTop chicken store.  His two young children are in elementary school.

Efrain’s objective has been the construction of his house.  He has achieved this with twelve loan cycles with Afodenic.  With the previous loan he managed to build a porch on the back part of the house.  That is where the clothes are washed, and this way it can be done under better conditions.

Now with this new loan he will change the roof on the side where the rooms are.  He will do part of the roof because the materials are very expensive, and he needs to consider his ability to make payments.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheeting in order to change the roof of the rooms to improve the condition of his house.

loans.name: Tillo

texts.ru: Тилло жительница района Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее старший сын и муж уехали на заработки в Москву. Сама Тилло занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки клубники, яблок, груши, помидоров и винограда.
texts.en: Tillo lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-nine years old, married and has four children. Her husband and oldest son work in Moscow. Tillo rents a stall on the market, selling fruits and vegetables. Her business has been active for the past twenty years. She's asking for a loan to buy strawberries, apples, pears, tomatoes and grapes.

loans.use: to purchase strawberries, apples, pears, tomatoes and grapes

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Precilla has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. She has had this business for 4 years and has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Precilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 31 years old and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Her spouse works as a welder. Janette has a business selling LPG (Liquefied Petroleum Gas) in the village where she lives. She sells the LPG in front of her house. Janette earns P2,000 in her business.

She is requesting for a loan of P15,000 to buy additional LPG to sell in the village. She needs to purchase additional LPG to earn higher profits to support the education of her children. 

Janette would like to educate all her children to have their own degree, which leads them to better employment and brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy additional LPG to sell in the village

loans.name: Deysi Isabel

texts.es: Deysi Isabel de 31 años de edad, reside en casa propia en uno de los municipios mas populosos del país, junto con su grupo familiar que está integrado por su esposo, 3 hijos y su querida madre de 70 años. Deysi posee un puesto en el mercado central de la zona donde ella habita en el cual vende variedad de prendas de vestir para todos los gustos, tamaños y preferencias. Es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Cuenta con mucha clientela gracias al carisma y amabilidad que la caracterizan. La ubicación del puesto es muy estratégico ya que se encuentra  a orillan de calle y es muy transitada. Ha trabajado duramente por muchos años para colaborar con la economía de su hogar ya que no le es suficiente con los ingresos que recibe de su esposo para mantener y darles las condiciones adecuadas a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su puesto en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: pantalones, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, blusas, camisetas, etc. de tal manera que su negocio sea atractivo y logre atraer a más clientes con el objetivo de lograr un aumento en el nivel de ventas. Y a si poder mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Deysi Isabel, 31 years old, resides in her home in one of the most populated municipalities of the country with her family that consists of her husband, three sons, and her beloved mother of 70 years of age. Deysi owns a stall in the central market of the area where she lives from which she sells a variety of clothing for all tastes, sizes, and preferences. She is a hard-working, responsible woman. She has many customers thanks to the charisma and kindness which characterize her. The location of the stall is very strategic as it is located on the border of the street and is very busy. She has worked very hard for many years to collaborate with the finances of her home as they are not enough to support and provide her family with adequate conditions with the earnings that her husband receives. She has made the decision to apply to Integral for a loan in order to invest in her stall by buying a variety of clothing like pants, skirts, undergarments, blouses, shirts, etc. so that her business will be more attractive and will manage to attract more customers with the objective of attaining an increase in the level of sales, in this way being able to better the condition of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing like: pants, skirts, dresses, undergarments, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina nació en la ciudad de Yanatile y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.  

La señora Paulina tiene 36 años y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y tiene un pequeño restaurante donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the town of Yanitile and lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre de Dios department.

Paulina is 36 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a hard-working mother who supports her family.  She has a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Paulina needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, etc.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet once a month in the town of Salvación.

The depths of the rainforest of Madre de Dios are home to many natural riches.  The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty.  In the large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers where it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga is a married man with six school-going children. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Mutunga has operated a charcoal selling business for the past six years. In addition he also sells maize. His potential clients are the local area brokers. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of buying a motorcycle for easy transport.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and maize for resale.

loans.name: Seut

texts.en:
Seut (in the photo with her loom) is 38 years old, and her husband, Pon, is 40 years old. They live in a village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children - four sons and two daughters. Five are in school and the other one is still young.  

Seut and her husband are weavers. Besides weaving, they also grow rice. Seut is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: María, nuevamente necesita un crédito, porque en esta época D. poca lluvia, aprovechara D. sembrar plantas y comprara: plantas frutales, ornamentales macetas, abono orgánico y químico, a si podrá tener más variedad para ofrecerles a los clientes. Los anteriores prestamos le ayudaron mucho pues le genero más ganancias y pago varias deudas y le permitió mejorar las condiciones del vivero.
texts.en: María needs a loan again. Since this is the rainy season, she will take advantage of the planting season and buy: fruit plants, ornamental pots, and organic and chemical fertilizer. In this way, she will have more variety to offer her customers. The previous loans helped her a lot and generated a lot of income for her. She paid off several loans that allowed her to improve the conditions of her green house.

loans.use: to buy fruit plants, ornamental pots, and organic and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 34 year old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 11 and 4.  Two of them go to school. 

Victoria runs a food store, and has been in the business for 6 years. She has 1 employee. Victoria heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.Victoria is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items like sorghum, maize, dried cassava, and millet. Aside from this business, Victoria has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Victoria would like to change her corrugated iron shop for a concrete building.  

Her major challenges include expensive schools in Juba for the children. Victoria says that, the loan will help her to build corrugated iron house for their accommodation.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sorghum, maize, dried cassava, and millet.

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
La socia Vilma Flora se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de manjares y yogurt,ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de manjares y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para hacer yogures como leche,azucar y mantequilla al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma Flora continues to work in her business selling caramelized milk products and yogurt. She works independently, taking her products to various places. She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. Through this business, the borrower is helping her children get ahead in life. She would like to expand and improve her business selling milk-based sweets and yogurt. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make her products, such as milk, sugar and butter, on a wholesale basis. 

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make milk-based sweets and yogurt, such as milk, sugar and butter, on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Mixtalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mixtalía, se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátano y yuca, vive con su familia, sus hijos y su esposo, ella inició con este negocio por iniciativa propia no tiene un horario fijo y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas ni inconvenientes con el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar plátanos, yuca, aceite, bolsas para el negocio,esta compra le permitirá tener los materiales necesarios para hacer la venta, dándole la oportunidad de continuar en el negocio y generar ingresos. Mixtalia aspira tener un negocio grande, más fortalecido para que las condiciones de vida de sus hijos sean más confortables.
texts.en:
Mixtalía sells yucca and plantain tostadas, lives with her family; her children and husband, and began this business through her own initiative.  She doesn’t have a set schedule and until now has not had problems nor inconveniences with the business.

She’s asking for this loan to buy plantains, yucca, cooking oil, and bags for her business.  This purchase will allow her to have the materials she needs for her sales, giving her the opportunity to continue her business and generate income.  Mixtalía aspires to have a large, stronger business so that she can provide a more comfortable life for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a widow and has six dependents. Adwoa is a palm oil extractor. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. 

Adwoa will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit for her oil. With the new profit, Adwoa will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for her oil.

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 52 years old, and married with six children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Rodilyn has been farming rice for 20 years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for over ten years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a sub leader in the village. One of her children is a driver. Selling fish is the main source of income in the family. Therefore, in order to improve her family finances, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to use in her business for transporting fish to sell at the market. By doing so, she would easily transport her fish to sell and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business by a large amount. In addition, she plans to build a kitchen and support her youngest child to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in her business for transporting fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single parent and has two children. She sells African print cloth and fabrics at Elmina, which she has done for some years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. Comfort will use her loan to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Fifonsi Nathalie

texts.fr: Fifonsi Nathalie âgée de 39 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école mais a appris, activité qu’elle exerce depuis douze. Fifonsi Nathalie est célibataire et vit seule. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par elle. Pour cette raison, Fifonsi Nathalie vend également des tissus par la technique de distribution ; cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Fifonsi Nathalie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Fifonsi Nathalie  pour une quatrième fois sollicite, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Mrs. Martha U. is a business woman who specializes in the sales of baby things. She is happily married with seven (7) children. She needs the above amount for her business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Soum R. is 29 years old and is a mother of two children. She lives with her husband in Preyveng, Cambodia. She and her husband sell a variety of vegetables at the nearby market and typically make around $8/day in revenue. R. asks for $1000 loan fund to purchase more vegetables in response to a great demand of her clients.  In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler who makes more income from this kind of business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy 2 steers

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Location: Chamissava area - Catembe
Client: António D. Conceição
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 13,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 520.00)
Use: Purchase products for resale
Start date: 08/06/2007
End date: 11/28/2008

António D. Conceição was born in Maputo in 1974 and attended school only until the 9th grade as his parents were not capable of paying for his school. He married young, and at the age of 18 he was faced with the need to obtain employment to support his studies and his family. He found a job as a mechanic's assistant.

He currently has 3 children and lives with his wife of 14 years. The mechanic shop was not a sufficient source of income, so he had to start his own business as a way to better provide for his family.

He currently operates out of a small rented commercial space where he carries out the sale of essential products. With the 13,000 MT loan ($520.00) he plans to increase his volume by acquiring a diverse range of essential products. He runs the business himself and has had a positive impact on the community by placing the product closer to the client, thereby shortening travel distances for the residents of his area while increasing his family's monthly income.

In the future he plans to develop his business further and become a successful merchant.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe
Cliente: António D. Conceição
Actividade : Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo: 13,000.00mt (520.00US$)
Aplicação: compra de Produtos para revenD.
Início: 06/08/2007
Fim: 28/11/ 2008

António D. Conceição nascido em Maputo em 1974 , estudou até 9ªclasse porque os pais não tinham condições para custear com os seus estudos. Juntou se muito cedo e aos 18 anos sentiu se obrigado a a ter que arranjar emprego para suportar os seus estudos e para o sustento D. sua família, tendo começado trabalhado como ajudante de mecânica.

Tem actualmente 3 filhos e vive com com a sua esposa já a 14 anos.Dado que o serviço de mecânica não estava a render lhe o suficiente , teve que iniciar o seu próprio negócio de forma a incrementar a renD. familiar.

Actualmente opera num pequeno estabelecimento comercial arrendaD. onde desenvolve a sua actividade comercial de venD. de produtos D. primeira necessidade. Com o crédito de 13,000.00MT pretende incrementar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo diversa gama de produtos de 1 necessidade. Ele gere o negócio pessoalmente e a sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois coloca o produto mais perto do cliente incurtando deste modo a distância para os moradores D. sua zona , bem como aumenta a renD. mensal familiar.

Futuramente pretende desenvolver o seu negócio tornando se num grande comerciante.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" of Callería District in ucayali State. She is 32 years old and single. She began the business of selling juanes and tamales with her mother, who taught her to work and business strategies, so that in the future she could own and manage her own business. (Juanes are an Amazonian dish, consisting of rice, chicken, black olives, and eggs all wrapped tightly in a large leaf from the jungle.) Upon receiving her first loan of 300 soles in 1992, she decided to become independent and she started her own business selling Juanes and tamales in the market.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 1300 soles (approximately US$433), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will be able to buy the ingredients to prepare the juanes and tamales (100-150 prepared daily) and she will pay the personnel who support her, as today the demand on her business is great.

Zoila is happy because she feels she is a capable woman and accomplished personally and in business, and in the future is planning to install a soda fountain and be able to employ additional people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es soltera, inició el negocio de venta de juanes y tamales junto a su mamá, quien le enseñó a trabajar y a conocer las estrategias del mismo, para que a futuro ella tenga el manejo y la administración de su propio negocio, ya en el año 1992 Zoila al recibir el primer préstamo que recibió de S/ 300 soles decidió independizarse, instaló su propio negocio de venta de Juanes y tamales en un mercado.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,300.00 (US$ 433.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá comprar los ingredientes para la preparación de los juanes y tamales (100-150 diarios) y pagará al personal que la apoya, ya que en la actualidad la demanda que tiene en su negocio es mayor.

Zoila esta contenta porque se siente una mujer capaz y desarrollada tanto en lo personal como en lo económico, y a futuro esta proyectandose en poner una fuente de soda y así también podrá dar trabajo a otras personas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make juanes and tamales

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
In the rural town of Tanita, Matrida L. (commonly and affectionately known as Mama L.) sells milk, vegetables and soap. The vegetables were a new addition in 2006 but it is her original milk-selling business, established in 2001, into which Mama L. wants to inject some new capital. She wants to revitalise the business by increasing her stock and purchasing a wider range of types and brands.

Mama L. is married to husband Felix and has three children, Franki, 18, Godwini, 17, and Dicsoni, 15. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can continue to support her family.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of milk for her stall

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang N., 36 year old, trades local commodities like bananas, coconuts and coconut leaves. She has been in the business for a year. Ni Komang travels from one village to another with her motorcycle to buy commodities from local farmers to be resold to wholesaler. At this time, the demand for commodities are significant, especially around Hindu holidays. Those commodities are sold in Denpasar by wholesalers to vendors in local markets. Because of lack of funding, Ni Komang N. often cannot fulfill all orders. WIth a loan of $560, Ni Komang N. should be able to buy more inventories to fulfill all orders. She wants to serve the farmers whom she buys her products from better. Ni Komang always pays cash to the farmers so she earns their trust and prefers to do business with her. In every transactions, Ni Komang N. can reap $11 profit. That earnings can support her familyś needs and she could also save significantly for her familyś future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang N., 36 tahun, mempunyai usaha jual beli hasil bumi yang berupa pisang, kelapa yang dikupas dan daun kelapa muda. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak dua tahun yang lalu. Dengan sepeda motor yang dimilikinya, Ni Komang N. berkeliling dari satu desa ke desa yang lain untuk mencari dagangan yang nantinya akan dijual kembali kepada pedagang besar. Saat ini kebutuhan akan hasil bumi sangat besar terutama menjelang hari raya umay Hindu. Semua hasil bumi itu akan dijual ke Denpasar oleh pedagang besar. Karena kekurangan modal, seringkali Ni Komang N. tidak bisa memenuhi pesanan. Dengan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- , Ni Komang N. bisa membeli hasil bumi dengan jumlah yang cukup lumayan sehingga pesanan akan terpenuhi. Yang paling penting bagi Ni Komang N. adalah pelayanannya kepada petani yang dibeli hasil buminya. Ni Komang N. selalu membayar langsung kepada petani saat membeli dagangannya sehingga petani pun akan merasa puas dan akan kembali menjual kepadanya. Setiap transaksi, Ni Koman N. bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 100.000.- Penghasilan itu bisa untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, untuk modal usaha dan disisihkan untuk ditabung.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has been a member of the community bank “8th of September” for 18 months.  She is from the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.
Sonia is 32 years old, and by profession she is a nurse.  She makes andean shingles, which are used on most of the roofs in the area.  She learned this profession from her parents.  Sonia mentioned that in the past she was able to produce very little, but with loans from the community bank she is able to produce much more.  She sells her products in her native town to people who then transport them to other villages in the area.
In addition, Sonia works as a nurse in the city of Cangallo.  While she is working as a nurse her sister helps with the tile business.
Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wood and pay laborers.  
One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Sonia plans to use her savings to build a home, and to start a new business selling food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar.  Her dream is to continue studying and specialize in anesthesiology and to have a successful business.

loans.use: Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wood and pay laborers.
